
Name: CVE-1999-0151
Status: Entry
Reference: CERT:CA-95.07a.REVISED.satan.vul
Reference: CERT:CA-95.06.satan.vul

The SATAN session key may be disclosed if the user points the web
browser to other sites, possibly allowing root access.

   contain a vulnerability that may crash the broswer when a malicious web site

   characters than the browser supports.

======================================================
Name: CVE-1999-0537
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-1999-0537
Phase: Proposed (19990726)
Category: CF

A configuration in a web browser such as Internet Explorer or Netscape
Navigator allows execution of active content such as ActiveX, Java,
Javascript, etc.


Current Votes:
   ACCEPT(1) Wall
   NOOP(1) Baker
   RECAST(1) Frech
   REJECT(1) LeBlanc

Voter Comments:
 Frech> Good candidate for dot notation.
   XF:nav-java-enabled
   XF:nav-javascript-enabled
   XF:ie-active-content
   XF:ie-active-download
   XF:ie-active-scripting
   XF:ie-activex-execution
   XF:ie-java-enabled
   XF:netscape-javascript
   XF:netscape-java
   XF:zone-active-scripting
   XF:zone-activex-execution
   XF:zone-desktop-install
   XF:zone-low-channel
   XF:zone-file-download
   XF:zone-file-launch
   XF:zone-java-scripting
   XF:zone-low-java
   XF:zone-safe-scripting
   XF:zone-unsafe-scripting
 LeBlanc> Not a vulnerability. These are just checks for configuration
   settings that a user might have changed. I understand need to increase
   number of checks in a scanning product, but don't feel like these belong
   in CVE. Scanner vendors could argue that these entries are needed to
   keep a common language.
 Baker> Not sure about whether we should bother to include this type issue or not.  It does provide a stepping stone for further actions, but in and of itself it isn't a specific vulnerability.


======================================================
Name: CVE-1999-0607
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-1999-0607
Phase: Modified (20060608)
Category: CF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:19990420 Shopping Carts exposing CC data
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=92462991805485&w=2

quikstore.cgi in QuikStore shopping cart stores quikstore.cfg under
the web document root with insufficient access control, which allows
remote attackers to obtain the cleartext administrator password and
gain privileges.


Current Votes:
   ACCEPT(1) Baker
   MODIFY(1) Frech
   NOOP(3) Christey, Northcutt, Wall

Voter Comments:
 Frech> XF:quikstore-misconfig(3858)
 Christey> http://www.quikstore.com/help/pages/Security/security.htm says:
   
   "It is IMPORTANT that during the setup of the QuikStore program, you
   check to make sure that the cgi-bin or executable program directory
   of your web site not be viewable from the outside world. You don't
   want the users to have access to your programs or log files that could
   be stored there!
   
   ...
   
   If you can view or download these files from the browser, someone
   else can too"
   
   So is this a configuration problem?  See the configuration file at
   http://www.quikstore.com/help/pages/Configuration/configparametersfull.htm
   The [DIRECTORY_PATHS] section identifies pathnames and describes how
   pathnames are constructed.  It clearly uses relative pathnames,
   so all data is underneath the base directory!!
   
   If we call this a configuration problem, then maybe this (and
   all other "CGI-data-in-web-tree" configuration problems) should
   be combined.
 Christey> Consider adding BID:1983


======================================================
Name: CVE-1999-0762
Status: Entry
Reference: XF:netscape-title
Reference: BUGTRAQ:19990524 Netscape Communicator JavaScript in <TITLE> security vulnerability

When Javascript is embedded within the TITLE tag, Netscape
Communicator allows a remote attacker to use the "about" protocol to
gain access to browser information.

======================================================
Name: CVE-1999-1380
Status: Entry
Reference: MISC:http://www.net-security.sk/bugs/NT/nu20.html
Reference: MISC:http://mlarchive.ima.com/win95/1997/May/0342.html
Reference: MISC:http://news.zdnet.co.uk/story/0,,s2065518,00.html
Reference: XF:nu-tuneocx-activex-control(7188)
Reference: URL:http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7188.php

Symantec Norton Utilities 2.0 for Windows 95 marks the TUNEOCX.OCX
ActiveX control as safe for scripting, which allows remote attackers
to execute arbitrary commands via the run option through malicious web
pages that are accessed by browsers such as Internet Explorer 3.0.

Name: CVE-1999-1473
Status: Entry
Reference: MSKB:Q176697
Reference: URL:http://support.microsoft.com/support/kb/articles/q176/6/97.asp

Explorer 3.02 and 4.0 automatically resends authentication information
to the second site, aka the "Page Redirect Issue."

======================================================
Name: CVE-1999-1474
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-1999-1474
Phase: Proposed (20010912)
Category: SF
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.microsoft.com/windows/ie/security/powerpoint.asp
Reference: XF:nt-ppt-patch(179)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/static/179.php

PowerPoint 95 and 97 allows remote attackers to cause an application
to be run automatically without prompting the user, possibly through
the slide show, when the document is opened in browsers such as
Internet Explorer.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2000-0403
Status: Entry
Reference: MS:MS00-036
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/ms00-036.asp
Reference: MSKB:Q263307
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/support/kb.asp?ID=263307
Reference: XF:win-browser-hostannouncement
Reference: BID:1261
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/1261

The CIFS Computer Browser service on Windows NT 4.0 allows a remote
attacker to cause a denial of service by sending a large number of
host announcement requests to the master browse tables, aka the
"HostAnnouncement Flooding" or "HostAnnouncement Frame" vulnerability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2000-0404
Status: Entry
Reference: MS:MS00-036
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/ms00-036.asp
Reference: MSKB:Q262694
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/support/kb.asp?ID=262694
Reference: BID:1262
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/1262
Reference: XF:win-browser-reset-frame

The CIFS Computer Browser service allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service by sending a ResetBrowser frame to the Master
Browser, aka the "ResetBrowser Frame" vulnerability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2000-0465
Status: Entry
Reference: MS:MS00-033
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/ms00-033.asp
Reference: MSKB:Q251108
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/support/kb.asp?ID=251108

Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/support/kb.asp?ID=255676
Reference: BID:1224
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/1224
Reference: XF:ie-frame-domain-verification

Internet Explorer 4.x and 5.x does properly verify the domain of a
frame within a browser window, which allows a remote attacker to read
client files via the frame, aka the "Frame Domain Verification"
vulnerability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2000-1205
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2000-1205
Phase: Modified (20070926)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20021223 Re: 'printenv' XSS vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://archive.cert.uni-stuttgart.de/bugtraq/2002/12/msg00243.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://httpd.apache.org/info/css-security/apache_specific.html
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20021222 'printenv' XSS vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/bugtraq/2002-12/0233.html
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20070724 printenv.pl(all versions) cross site scripting Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=118529436424127&w=2
Reference: XF:apache-printenv-xss(10938)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/10938
Reference: XF:apache-printenv-acuparam-xss(35597)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/35597

Cross site scripting vulnerabilities in Apache 1.3.0 through 1.3.11
allow remote attackers to execute script as other web site visitors
via (1) the printenv CGI (printenv.pl), which does not encode its
output, (2) pages generated by the ap_send_error_response function
such as a default 404, which does not add an explicit charset, or (3)
various messages that are generated by certain Apache modules or core
code.  NOTE: the printenv issue might still exist for web browsers
that can render text/plain content types as HTML, such as Internet
Explorer, but CVE regards this as a design limitation of those
browsers, not Apache.  The printenv.pl/acuparam vector, discloser on
20070724, is one such variant.


Current Votes:
   ACCEPT(7) Armstrong, Baker, Cole, Cox, Foat, Green, Wall
   MODIFY(1) Frech

Voter Comments:
 Frech> XF:apache-printenv-xss(10938)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2001-0092
Status: Entry
Reference: MS:MS00-093
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/ms00-093.asp
Reference: XF:ie-frame-verification-read-files(6086)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/6086
Reference: OSVDB:7817
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/7817

A function in Internet Explorer 5.0 through 5.5 does not properly
verify the domain of a frame within a browser window, which allows a
remote attacker to read client files, aka a new variant of the "Frame
Domain Verification" vulnerability.

======================================================

arbitrary commands via the mostbrowsers parameter, whose value is used
as part of a generated Perl script.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2001-0246
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2001-0246
Phase: Proposed (20010524)
Category: SF
Reference: MS:MS01-027
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/MS01-027.asp

Internet Explorer 5.5 and earlier does not properly verify the domain
of a frame within a browser window, which allows remote web site
operators to read certain files on the client by sending information
from a local frame to a frame in a different domain, aka a variant of
the "Frame Domain Verification" vulnerability.


Current Votes:
   ACCEPT(5) Baker, Cole, Magdych, Wall, Williams
   MODIFY(1) Frech
   NOOP(2) Renaud, Ziese
   REVIEWING(1) Christey

Voter Comments:
 Christey> See comments for CVE-2001-0332; may need to be merged because
   of CD:SF-LOC.
 Frech> XF:ie-frame-verification-variant(6748)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2001-0322
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2001-0322
Phase: Proposed (20010404)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20010115 Stack Overflow in MSHTML.DLL
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=97958685100219&w=2
Reference: BID:2202
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/2202
Reference: XF:ie-mshtml-dos
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/static/5938.php

MSHTML.DLL HTML parser in Internet Explorer 4.0, and other versions,
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application
crash) via a script that creates and deletes an object that is
associated with the browser window object.

   REVIEWING(2) Bishop, Wall

======================================================
Name: CVE-2001-0332
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2001-0332
Phase: Proposed (20010524)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20010330 Security bug in Internet Explorer - MSScriptControl.ScriptControl
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=98609031517525&w=2
Reference: MS:MS01-027
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/MS01-027.asp

Internet Explorer 5.5 and earlier does not properly verify the domain
of a frame within a browser window, which allows remote web site
operators to read certain files on the client by sending information
from a local frame to a frame in a different domain using
MSScriptControl.ScriptControl and GetObject, aka a variant of the
"Frame Domain Verification" vulnerability.


Current Votes:
   ACCEPT(4) Baker, Cole, Wall, Ziese
   MODIFY(1) Frech
   NOOP(1) Renaud
   RECAST(1) Williams
   REJECT(1) Magdych
   REVIEWING(1) Christey

Voter Comments:
 Magdych> Duplicate of CVE-0246
 Christey> While it may look like CVE-2001-0332 is a duplicate of
   CVE-2001-0246, Microsoft specifically identifies two separate
   variants of the same problem in its advisory, namely 0332 and
   0246.  However, CD:SF-LOC currently suggests merging problems
   of the same type that appear and are fixed in the same
   software versions, and thus these 2 candidates *might*
   in fact be duplicates - relative to CD:SF-LOC.  Microsoft
   needs to be consulted on this.
 Williams> merge with CVE-0246
 Frech> XF:ie-frame-verification-read-files(6086)
   XF:ie-frame-verification-variant(6748)
   CVE-2001-0092 is also assigned to the
   ie-frame-verification-files(6086), but shouldn't be considered a
   duplicate.


======================================================
Name: CVE-2001-0712
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2001-0712
Phase: Proposed (20011012)
Category: SF/CF/MP/SA/AN/unknown
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20010727 TXT or HTML? -- IE NEW BUG
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/200109
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20010729 Re: TXT or HTML? -- IE NEW BUG
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/200291
Reference: BID:3116
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/3116

The rendering engine in Internet Explorer determines the MIME type
independently of the type that is specified by the server, which
allows remote servers to automatically execute script which is placed
in a file whose MIME type does not normally support scripting, such as
text (.txt), JPEG (.jpg), etc.


Current Votes:
   ACCEPT(2) Baker, Cole
   NOOP(1) Armstrong
   REJECT(2) Foat, Frech
   REVIEWING(1) Wall

Voter Comments:
 Baker> I would argue that a browser executing a script when it shouldn't is still a vulnerability.  If it is supposed to be a non-scriptable file type, and that fails, resulting in a script being executed without the user's knowledge, then it is a problem, and thus should be included as a vulnerability.  I vote this should be accepted, and if Microsoft acknowledges this in their follow up, then you have vendor acknowledgement of the problem as well.
 Foat> The candidate does not meet the criteria for a vulnerability or 
   exposure, even though it describes an unexpected behavior.


======================================================
Name: CVE-2001-0921
Status: Entry
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20011121 Mac Netscape password fields
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=100638816318705&w=2
Reference: XF:macos-netscape-print-passwords(7593)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/static/7593.php
Reference: BID:3565
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/3565
Reference: OSVDB:5524
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/5524

Netscape 4.79 and earlier for MacOS allows an attacker with access to
the browser to obtain passwords from form fields by printing the
document into which the password has been typed, which is printed in
cleartext.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2001-1245
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2001-1245
Phase: Proposed (20020502)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20010712 Re: Opera Browser Heap Overflow (Session Replay Attack)
Reference: URL:http://online.securityfocus.com/archive/1/196980
Reference: XF:opera-browser-header-bo(6838)
Reference: URL:http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/6838.php
Reference: BID:3012
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/3012

Opera 5.0 for Linux does not properly handle malformed HTTP headers,
which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service, possibly
with a header whose value is the same as a MIME header name.

   NOOP(3) Cox, Foat, Wall

Voter Comments:
 CHANGE> [Green changed vote from REVIEWING to ACCEPT]


======================================================
Name: CVE-2001-1403
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2001-1403
Phase: Proposed (20020830)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20010829 Security Advisory for Bugzilla v2.13 and older

Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2001:107
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2001-107.html

Bugzilla before 2.14 includes the username and password in URLs, which
could allow attackers to gain privileges by reading the information
from the web server logs, or by "shoulder-surfing" and observing the
web browser's location bar.

   MODIFY(1) Frech

======================================================
Name: CVE-2001-1450
Status: Candidate

======================================================
Name: CVE-2001-1545
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2001-1545
Phase: Assigned (20050714)
Category: SF
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.macromedia.com/v1/handlers/index.cfm?ID=22291&Method=Full
Reference: BID:3665
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/3665
Reference: XF:allaire-jrun-jsessionid-appended(7679)
Reference: URL:http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7679.php

Macromedia JRun 3.0 and 3.1 appends the jsessionid to URL requests
(a.k.a. rewriting) when client browsers have cookies enabled, which
allows remote attackers to obtain session IDs and hijack sessions via
HTTP referrer fields or sniffing.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-0269
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-0269
Phase: Proposed (20020502)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020212 [GSA2002-01] Web browsers ignore the Content-Type header, thus allowing cross-site scripting
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=101363764421623&w=2

Internet Explorer 5.x and 6 interprets an object as an HTML document
even when its MIME Content-Type is text/plain, which could allow
remote attackers to execute arbitrary script in documents that the
user does not expect, possibly through web applications that use a
text/plain type to prevent cross-site scripting attacks.


Current Votes:
   MODIFY(1) Frech
   NOOP(4) Armstrong, Cole, Cox, Foat
   REVIEWING(1) Wall

Voter Comments:
 Frech> XF:ie-opera-contenttype-css(8218)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-0270
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-0270
Phase: Proposed (20020502)
Category: CF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020212 [GSA2002-01] Web browsers ignore the Content-Type header, thus allowing cross-site scripting
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=101363764421623&w=2

Opera, when configured with the "Determine action by MIME type" option
disabled, interprets an object as an HTML document even when its MIME
Content-Type is text/plain, which could allow remote attackers to
execute arbitrary script in documents that the user does not expect,
possibly through web applications that use a text/plain type to
prevent cross-site scripting attacks.


Current Votes:
   MODIFY(1) Frech
   NOOP(5) Christey, Cole, Cox, Foat, Wall
   REJECT(1) Armstrong

Voter Comments:
 Frech> XF:ie-opera-contenttype-css(8218)
 Christey> BID:4098
   URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/4098


======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-0354
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-0354
Phase: Proposed (20020502)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020430 Reading local files in Netscape 6 and Mozilla (GM#001-NS)
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=102017952204097&w=2

Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=ntbugtraq&m=102020343728766&w=2

The XMLHttpRequest object (XMLHTTP) in Netscape 6.1 and Mozilla 0.9.7
allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files and list directories
on a client system by opening a URL that redirects the browser to the
file on the client, then reading the result using the responseText
property.

Name: CVE-2002-0487

Intellisol Xpede 4.1 stores passwords in plaintext in a Javascript
"session timeout" re-authentication capability, which could allow
local users with access to gain privileges of other Xpede users by
reading the password from the source file, e.g. from the browser's
cache.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-0809
Status: Entry
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020608 [BUGZILLA] Security Advisory For Versions of Bugzilla 2.14 before 2.14.2, and 2.16 before 2.16rc2
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/bugtraq/2002-06/0054.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=148674
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2002:109
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2002-109.html
Reference: BID:4964
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/4964
Reference: XF:bugzilla-group-permissions-removal(10141)
Reference: URL:http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/10141.php

Bugzilla 2.14 before 2.14.2, and 2.16 before 2.16rc2, does not
properly handle URL-encoded field names that are generated by some
browsers, which could cause certain fields to appear to be unset,
which has the effect of removing group permissions on bugs when
buglist.cgi is provided with the encoded field names.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-0815
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-0815
Phase: Proposed (20020830)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020729 XWT Foundation Advisory: Firewall circumvention possible with all browsers
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=102796732924658&w=2
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020729 RE: XWT Foundation Advisory
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=102798282208686&w=2

The Javascript "Same Origin Policy" (SOP), as implemented in (1)
Netscape, (2) Mozilla, and (3) Internet Explorer, allows a remote web
server to access HTTP and SOAP/XML content from restricted sites by
mapping the malicious server's parent DNS domain name to the
restricted site, loading a page from the restricted site into one
frame, and passing the information to the attacker-controlled frame,
which is allowed because the document.domain of the two frames matches
on the parent domain.


Current Votes:
   ACCEPT(1) Baker
   NOOP(4) Cole, Cox, Foat, Wall



======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-0832
Status: Candidate

Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=102864890006745&w=2

Internet Explorer 5, 5.6, and 6 allows remote attackers to bypass
cookie privacy settings and store information across browser sessions
via the userData (storeuserData) feature.


Current Votes:
   ACCEPT(2) Baker, Foat
   MODIFY(1) Frech
   NOOP(3) Armstrong, Cole, Cox
   REVIEWING(1) Wall

Voter Comments:
 Foat> This is more an exposure than a vulnerability. IE does have, as the
   autho0r contends, a "user data persistence" feature that is independent of the
   settings used to control cookies. Microsoft allows a user to turn off the
   feature via a simple setting. Bottom line, this is a configuration problem.
 Frech> XF:ie-bypass-cookie-restrictions(10459)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-0934
Status: Candidate

installed as af.cgi or alienform.cgi) allows remote attackers to read
or modify arbitrary files via an illegal character in the middle of a
.. (dot dot) sequence in the parameters (1) _browser_out or (2)
_out_file.

Name: CVE-2002-1008
Status: Candidate

Phase: Proposed (20020830)

Cross-site scripting vulnerability in PowerBASIC urlcount.cgi, as
included in Lil' HTTP web server, allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary web script in other web browsers via a request to
urlcount.cgi that contains the script, which is not filtered when the
REPORT capability prints the original request.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-1126
Status: Entry
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020911 Privacy leak in mozilla
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=103176760004720&w=2
Reference: CONFIRM:http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=145579
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2002:192
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2002-192.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2003:046
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2003-046.html
Reference: MANDRAKE:MDKSA-2002:075
Reference: URL:http://www.mandrakesoft.com/security/advisories?name=MDKSA-2002:075
Reference: XF:mozilla-onunload-url-leak(10084)
Reference: URL:http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/10084.php
Reference: BID:5694
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/5694

Mozilla 1.1 and earlier, and Mozilla-based browsers such as Netscape
and Galeon, set the document referrer too quickly in certain
situations when a new page is being loaded, which allows web pages to
determine the next page that is being visited, including manually
entered URLs, using the onunload handler.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-1210
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-1210

Category: SF

Reference: MISC:http://www.idefense.com/advisory/11.19.02b.txt

Qualcomm Eudora 5.1.1, 5.2, and possibly other versions stores email
attachments in a predictable location, which allows remote attackers
to read arbitrary files via a link that loads an attachment with
malicious script into a frame, which then executes the script in the
local browser context.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-1625
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-1625
Phase: Assigned (20050326)
Category: SF
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.macromedia.com/v1/handlers/index.cfm?ID=22796&Method=Full&Title=Macromedia%20Flash%20Player%206%20Streaming%20Issue&Cache=False

Reference: XF:flash-activex-plugin-dos(8925)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/8925

Macromedia Flash Player 6 does not terminate connections when the user
leaves the web page, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial
of service (bandwidth, resource, and CPU consumption) via the (1)
loadMovie or (2) loadSound commands, which continue to execute until
the browser is closed.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-1688
Status: Candidate

The browser history feature in Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.5 through
6.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary script as other users
and steal authentication information via cookies by injecting
JavaScript into the URL, which is executed when the user hits the Back
button.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-1849
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-1849
Phase: Assigned (20050629)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020731 FW: Parachat DoS Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/bugtraq/2002-07/0427.html
Reference: BID:5370
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/5370
Reference: XF:parachat-no-logoff-dos(9735)
Reference: URL:http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/9735.php

ParaChat Server 4.0 does not log users off if the browser's back
button is used, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of
service by repeatedly logging into a chat room, hitting the back
button, then logging into the same chat room as a different user,
which fills the chat room with invalid users.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2002-1881
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-1881
Phase: Assigned (20050629)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20020811 Re: EEYE: Macromedia Shockwave Flash Malformed Header Overflow
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/bugtraq/2002-08/0088.html

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/5445
Reference: XF:flash-swf-rot13-dos(9843)
Reference: URL:http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/9843.php

Macromedia Flash Player 4.0 r12 through 6.0.47.0 allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (web browser crash) via
malformed content in a Flash Shockwave (.SWF) file, as demonstrated by
by ROT13 encoding the body of the file but not the headers.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2003-0054
Status: Entry
Reference: ATSTAKE:A032403-1
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20030224 QuickTime/Darwin Streaming Administration Server Multiple vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=104618904330226&w=2

Streaming Server 4.1.1 allows remote attackers to execute certain code
via a request to port 7070 with the script in an argument to the rtsp
DESCRIBE method, which is inserted into a log file and executed when
the log is viewed using a browser.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2003-0513
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2003-0513
Phase: Proposed (20040318)
Category: SF
Reference: FULLDISC:20040310 Corsaire Security Advisory: Multiple vendor HTTP user agent cookie path traversal issue
Reference: URL:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/2004-March/018475.html
Reference: VULNWATCH:20040310 Corsaire Security Advisory: Multiple vendor HTTP user agent cookie path traversal issue
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/vulnwatch/2004-q1/0056.html

Microsoft Internet Explorer allows remote attackers to bypass intended
cookie access restrictions on a web application via "%2e%2e" (encoded
dot dot) directory traversal sequences in a URL, which causes Internet
Explorer to send the cookie outside the specified URL subsets, e.g. to
a vulnerable application that runs on the same server as the target
application.


Current Votes:
   ACCEPT(5) Armstrong, Baker, Balinsky, Cole, Green
   MODIFY(1) Frech
   NOOP(1) Cox
   REVIEWING(2) Christey, Wall

Voter Comments:
 Frech> XF:web-browser-cookie-bypass(15424)
   http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/15424
 Christey> Consider whether this is really a design-level problem that applies to
   the interaction between any vulnerable XSS, its associated domain, and
   any web browser, because browsers enforce security boundaries at the
   domain level.  If so, then the "%2e%2e" problem may be a red herring,
   or a single attack vector of any number of vectors.
   
   CVE-2003-0513, CVE-2003-0514, CVE-2003-0592, CVE-2003-0593,
   and CVE-2003-0594 all cover this specific issue (each for a
   different browser).

Reference: BUGTRAQ:20030911 LiuDieYu's missing files are here.
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/337086
Reference: MS:MS03-048
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/ms03-048.asp
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#771604
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/771604
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#652452
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/652452
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:361
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:361
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:362
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:362
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:363
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:363
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:409
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:409
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:416
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:416
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:459
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:459
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:479
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:479
Reference: SECTRACK:1007687
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1007687
Reference: SECUNIA:10192
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/10192

Internet Explorer 6 SP1 and earlier allows remote attackers to bypass
zone restrictions by (1) using the NavigateAndFind method to load a
file: URL containing Javascript, as demonstrated by NAFfileJPU, (2)
using the window.open method to load a file: URL containing
Javascript, as demonstrated using WsOpenFileJPU, (3) setting the href
property in the base tag for the _search window, as demonstrated using
WsBASEjpu, (4) loading the search window into an Iframe, as
demonstrated using WsFakeSrc, (5) caching a javascript: URL in the
browser history, then accessing that URL in the same frame as the
target domain, as demonstrated using WsOpenJpuInHistory,
NAFjpuInHistory, BackMyParent, BackMyParent2, and RefBack, aka the
"Script URLs Cross Domain" vulnerability.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2003-1017
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2003-1017
Phase: Assigned (20031217)
Category: SF
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.macromedia.com/devnet/security/security_zone/mpsb03-08.html
Reference: BID:8900
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/8900
Reference: XF:flash-file-predictable-location(14013)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/14013

Macromedia Flash Player before 7,0,19,0 stores a Flash data file in a
predictable location that is accessible to web browsers such as
Internet Explorer and Opera, which allows remote attackers to read
restricted files via vulnerabilities in web browsers whose exploits
rely on predictable names.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

before 1.5.0_06, and as used in multiple web browsers, allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via deeply
nested object arrays, which are not properly handled by the garbage
collector and trigger invalid memory accesses.

Reference: BID:10358
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/10358
Reference: OSVDB:6107
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/6107
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:954
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:954
Reference: SECUNIA:11602
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/11602
Reference: XF:kde-url-handler-gain-access(16163)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/16163

The URI handlers in Konqueror for KDE 3.2.2 and earlier do not
properly filter "-" characters that begin a hostname in a (1) telnet,
(2) rlogin, (3) ssh, or (4) mailto URI, which allows remote attackers
to manipulate the options that are passed to the associated programs,
possibly to read arbitrary files or execute arbitrary code.

Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2004:392
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2004-392.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2004:395
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2004-395.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2004:405
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2004-405.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2005:816
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2005-816.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SA:2004:021
Reference: URL:http://www.novell.com/linux/security/advisories/2004_21_php4.html
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20040722 [OpenPKG-SA-2004.034] OpenPKG Security Advisory (php)
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=109051444105182&w=2
Reference: BID:10724
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/10724
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:10619
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:10619
Reference: XF:php-strip-tag-bypass(16692)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/16692

The strip_tags function in PHP 4.x up to 4.3.7, and 5.x up to
5.0.0RC3, does not filter null (\0) characters within tag names when
restricting input to allowed tags, which allows dangerous tags to be
processed by web browsers such as Internet Explorer and Safari, which
ignore null characters and facilitate the exploitation of cross-site
scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Opera 7.51 for Windows and 7.50 for Linux does not properly prevent a
frame in one domain from injecting content into a frame that belongs
to another domain, which facilitates web site spoofing and other
attacks, aka the frame injection vulnerability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2004-0779
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2004-0779
Phase: Assigned (20040813)
Category: SF
Reference: CONFIRM:http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=226278
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.mozilla.org/projects/security/known-vulnerabilities.html#mozilla1.7
Reference: MANDRAKE:MDKSA-2004:082
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDKSA-2004:082

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/17018

The (1) Mozilla 1.6, (2) Firebird 0.7 and (3) Firefox 0.8 web browsers
do not properly verify that cached passwords for SSL encrypted sites
are only sent via SSL encrypted sessions to the site, which allows a
remote attacker to cause a cached password to be sent in cleartext to
a spoofed site.

fixation attack and hijack a user's HTTP session.

Reference: XF:web-browser-cookie-session-hijack(17417)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/17417

Internet Explorer does not prevent cookies that are sent over an
insecure channel (HTTP) from also being sent over a secure channel
(HTTPS/SSL) in the same domain, which could allow remote attackers to
steal cookies and conduct unauthorized activities, aka "Cross Security
Boundary Cookie Injection."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Multiple vulnerabilities in Konqueror in KDE 3.3.1 and earlier (1)
allow access to restricted Java classes via JavaScript and (2) do not
properly restrict access to certain Java classes from the Java applet,
which allows remote attackers to bypass sandbox restrictions and read
or write arbitrary files.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2004-1155
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2004-1155
Phase: Assigned (20041208)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20061025 IE7 status: 8 days after release, 3 unfixed issues
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/449917/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2004-13/advisory/
Reference: BID:11855
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/11855

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/13251/
Reference: MISC:http://secunia.com/multiple_browsers_window_injection_vulnerability_test/
Reference: SECUNIA:22628
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22628

Internet Explorer 5.01 through 6 allows remote attackers to spoof
arbitrary web sites by injecting content from one window into another
window whose name is known but resides in a different domain, as
demonstrated using a pop-up window on a trusted web site, aka the
"window injection" vulnerability.  NOTE: later research shows that
Internet Explorer 7 on Windows XP SP2 is also vulnerable.

Name: CVE-2004-1165
Status: Candidate

Category: SF

Reference: MANDRAKE:MDKSA-2005:045
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDKSA-2005:045
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2005:009
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2005-009.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2005:065
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2005-065.html
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:9645
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:9645
Reference: XF:web-browser-ftp-command-execution(18384)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/18384

Konqueror 3.3.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary FTP
commands via an ftp:// URL that contains a URL-encoded newline ("%0a")
before the FTP command, which causes the commands to be inserted into
the resulting FTP session, as demonstrated using a PORT command.

6.0.2800.1106 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary
FTP commands via an ftp:// URL that contains a URL-encoded newline
("%0a") before the FTP command, which causes the commands to be
inserted into the resulting FTP session, as demonstrated using a PORT
command.

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:10211
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:10211
Reference: SECUNIA:12712
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/12712
Reference: MISC:http://secunia.com/multiple_browsers_dialog_box_spoofing_test/
Reference: MISC:http://secunia.com/multiple_browsers_form_field_focus_test/
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.mozilla.org/security/announce/mfsa2005-05.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2005:323
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2005-323.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2005:335
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2005-335.html
Reference: XF:web-browser-modal-spoofing(18864)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/18864

Firefox before 1.0 and Mozilla before 1.7.5 allows inactive
(background) tabs to launch dialog boxes, which can allow remote
attackers to spoof the dialog boxes from web sites in other windows
and facilitate phishing attacks, aka the "Dialog Box Spoofing
Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

(background) tabs to focus on input being entered in the active tab,

attackers to steal sensitive data that is intended for other sites,
which could facilitate phishing attacks.

demonstrated by mangleme.

Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060602 Re: [SECURITY] [DSA 1085-1] New lynx-cur packages fix several vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/435689/30/4740/threaded
Reference: FULLDISC:20041018 Web browsers - a mini-farce
Reference: URL:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/2004-October/027709.html
Reference: MISC:http://lcamtuf.coredump.cx/mangleme/gallery/
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-1077
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2006/dsa-1077
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-1076
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2006/dsa-1076
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-1085
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2006/dsa-1085
Reference: BID:11443
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/11443
Reference: SECTRACK:1011809
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1011809
Reference: SECUNIA:20383

Reference: XF:lynx-dos(17804)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/17804

Lynx, lynx-ssl, and lynx-cur before 2.8.6dev.8 allow remote attackers
to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a web page or HTML
email that contains invalid HTML including (1) a TEXTAREA tag with a
large COLS value and (2) a large tag name in an element that is not
terminated, as demonstrated by mangleme.  NOTE: a followup suggests
that the relevant trigger for this issue is the large COLS value.

and Firefox 0.9.3 on MacOS X 10.3.5, when tabbed browsing is enabled,

.8.5, and Mozilla before 1.7.6 allows remote attackers to spoof domain

SSL certificates in a way that uses homograph characters from other
character sets, which facilitates phishing attacks.

Category: SF
Reference: FULLDISC:20050206 state of homograph attacks
Reference: URL:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/2005-February/031459.html
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20050208 International Domain Name [IDN] support in modern browsers allows attackers to spoof domain name URLs + SSL certs.
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=110782704923280&w=2
Reference: MISC:http://www.shmoo.com/idn
Reference: MISC:http://www.shmoo.com/idn/homograph.txt
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SA:2005:031
Reference: URL:http://www.novell.com/linux/security/advisories/2005_31_opera.html
Reference: BID:12461
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/12461
Reference: XF:multiple-browsers-idn-spoof(19236)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/19236

The International Domain Name (IDN) support in Opera 7.54 allows
remote attackers to spoof domain names using punycode encoded domain
names that are decoded in URLs and SSL certificates in a way that uses
homograph characters from other character sets, which facilitates
phishing attacks.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2005:435
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2005-435.html
Reference: SCO:SCOSA-2005.49
Reference: URL:ftp://ftp.sco.com/pub/updates/OpenServer/SCOSA-2005.49/SCOSA-2005.49.txt
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#648758
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/648758
Reference: BID:13544
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/13544
Reference: BID:15495
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/15495
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:9231
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:9231
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2005-0493
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2005/0493
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:100001
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:100001
Reference: SECTRACK:1013913
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1013913
Reference: SECUNIA:15292
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/15292
Reference: XF:mozilla-javascript-code-execution(20443)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/20443

The install function in Firefox 1.0.3 allows remote web sites on the
browser's whitelist, such as update.mozilla.org or addon.mozilla.org,
to execute arbitrary Javascript with chrome privileges, leading to
arbitrary code execution on the system when combined with
vulnerabilities such as CVE-2005-1476, as demonstrated using a
javascript: URL as the package icon and a cross-site scripting (XSS)
attack on a vulnerable whitelist site.

Phase: Assigned (20050520)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20050520 pst.advisory: gedit fun. opensource is god .lol windows

Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2005-499.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SA:2005:036
Reference: URL:http://www.novell.com/linux/security/advisories/2005_36_sudo.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-138-1
Reference: URL:http://www.ubuntulinux.org/support/documentation/usn/usn-138-1
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:1245
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:1245

Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:9845

Format string vulnerability in gedit 2.10.2 may allow attackers to
cause a denial of service (application crash) via a bin file with
format string specifiers in the filename.  NOTE: while this issue is
triggered on the command line by the gedit user, it has been reported
that web browsers and email clients could be configured to provide a
file name as an argument to gedit, so there is a valid attack that
crosses security boundaries.

The browser user interface in Firefox before 1.0.5, Mozilla before
1.7.9, and Netscape 8.0.2 and 7.2 does not properly distinguish
between user-generated events and untrusted synthetic events, which
makes it easier for remote attackers to perform dangerous actions that
normally could only be performed manually by the user.

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/15489

Firefox before 1.0.5 and Mozilla before 1.7.9 does not clearly
associate a Javascript dialog box with the web page that generated it,
which allows remote attackers to spoof a dialog box from a trusted
site and facilitates phishing attacks, aka the "Dialog Origin Spoofing
Vulnerability."

cause a denial of service (application crash) via a large HTML file

Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=112559902931614&w=2
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-832
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2005/dsa-832
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#619812
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/619812
Reference: BID:14693
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/14693
Reference: SECUNIA:16614
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/16614/

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/17016

Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in University of Minnesota
gopher client 3.0.9 allow remote malicious servers to execute
arbitrary code via (1) a long "+VIEWS:" reply, which is not properly
handled in the VIfromLine function, and (2) certain arguments when
launching third party programs such as a web browser from a web link,
which is not properly handled in the FIOgetargv function.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2005-3310
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-3310
Phase: Assigned (20051026)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20051022 phpBB 2.0.17 (and other BB systems as well) Cookie disclosure
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=113017003617987&w=2
Reference: FULLDISC:20051022 phpBB 2.0.17 (and other BB systems as well) Cookie disclosure exploit.
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/fulldisclosure/2005-10/0479.html
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-925
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2005/dsa-925
Reference: BID:15170
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/15170
Reference: SECUNIA:17295
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/17295/
Reference: SECUNIA:18098
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/18098
Reference: XF:phpbb-avatar-bypass-security(22837)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/22837

Interpretation conflict in phpBB 2.0.17, with remote avatars and
avatar uploading enabled, allows remote authenticated users to inject
arbitrary web script or HTML via an HTML file with a GIF or JPEG file
extension, which causes the HTML to be executed by a victim who views
the file in Internet Explorer, which renders malformed image types as
HTML, enabling cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.  NOTE: it could be
argued that this vulnerability is due to a design flaw in Internet
Explorer (CVE-2005-3312) and the proper fix should be in that browser;
if so, then this should not be treated as a vulnerability in phpBB.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Invision Gallery 2.0.3 allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site
scripting (XSS) attacks via HTML or script in an image whose type does
not match its extension, which is rendered by Internet Explorer due to
CVE-2005-3312.  NOTE: it could be argued that this vulnerability is
due to a design flaw in Internet Explorer and the proper fix should be
in that browser; if so, then this should not be treated as a
vulnerability in Invision Gallery.

attackers to execute arbitrary web script or HTML.  NOTE: this

Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080505 Scout Portal Toolkit <= 1.4.0 (ParentId) Remote SQL Injection Exploit
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/491611/100/0/threaded
Reference: MILW0RM:5540
Reference: URL:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/5540
Reference: MISC:http://www.x-illusion.com/rs/Scout%20Portal%20Toolkit.txt
Reference: BID:15818
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/15818
Reference: BID:29034
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/29034
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2005-2844
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2005/2844
Reference: OSVDB:21625
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/21625
Reference: OSVDB:21626
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/21626
Reference: OSVDB:21627
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/21627
Reference: OSVDB:21628
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/21628
Reference: SECUNIA:17979
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/17979
Reference: XF:scoutportal-sql-injection(23547)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/23547
Reference: XF:scoutportal-browseresources-sql-injection(42169)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/42169

Multiple SQL injection vulnerabilities in Scout Portal Toolkit (SPT)
1.3.1 and earlier allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL
commands via (1) the ParentId parameter in SPT--BrowseResources.php,
(2) ResourceId parameter in SPT--FullRecord.php, (3) ResourceOffset
parameter in SPT--Home.php, and (4) F_UserName and (5) F_Password in
SPT--UserLogin.php.  NOTE: it was later reported that vector 1 is also
present in 1.4.0.

None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2005-4260
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-4260
Phase: Assigned (20051215)
Category: SF
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20051214 Bypass XSS filter in PHPNUKE 7.9=>x
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/419496/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20051220 Re: XSS bypass in PHPNuke - FIX ?
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/419991/100/0/threaded
Reference: BID:15855
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/15855

Interpretation conflict in includes/mainfile.php in PHP-Nuke 7.9 and
later allows remote attackers to perform cross-site scripting (XSS)
attacks by replacing the ">" in the tag with a "<", which bypasses the
regular expressions that sanitize the data, but is automatically
corrected by many web browsers.  NOTE: it could be argued that this
vulnerability is due to a design limitation of many web browsers; if
so, then this should not be treated as a vulnerability in PHP-Nuke.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2005-4426
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-4426
Phase: Assigned (20051220)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.yabbforum.com/downloads.php
Reference: BID:15368
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/15368
Reference: SECUNIA:17411
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/17411
Reference: XF:yabb-image-attachment-xss(23020)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/23020

Interpretation conflict in YaBB before 2.1 allows remote authenticated
users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via HTML in a file with a
GIF file extension, which causes the HTML to be executed by a victim
who views the file in Internet Explorer as a result of CVE-2005-3312.
NOTE: it could be argued that this vulnerability is due to a design
flaw in Internet Explorer and the proper fix should be in that
browser; if so, then this should not be treated as a vulnerability in
YaBB.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2005-4454
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-4454
Phase: Assigned (20051221)
Category: 
Reference: FULLDISC:20051220 LiveJournal CSS/JS injection vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=full-disclosure&m=113504421421972&w=2
Reference: FULLDISC:20051219 LiveJournal CSS/JS injection vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/fulldisclosure/2005-12/1000.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://cvs.livejournal.org/browse.cgi/livejournal/cgi-bin/cleanhtml.pl
Reference: BID:15990
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/15990
Reference: OSVDB:21896
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/21896
Reference: SECUNIA:18157
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/18157
Reference: XF:livejournal-javascript-xss(23839)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/23839

Validate-before-filter vulnerability in cleanhtml.pl 1.129 in
LiveJournal CVS before Dec 7 2005, when the cleancss option is
enabled, allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS)
attacks via a "\" (backslash) within a "javascript" scheme in a style
property (such as "javas\cript"), which bypasses the "javascript"
check before the "\" is stripped and then rendered in web browsers
that allow scripting in style sheets.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2005-4582
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2005-4582
Phase: Assigned (20051229)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20051223 Multiple Network-related Vulnerabilities in Electric Sheep
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/420161/100/0/threaded
Reference: SREASON:295
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/295
Reference: XF:electric-sheep-dns-spoofing(23892)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/23892

Electric Sheep 2.6.3 does not require authentication or integrity
checks from the server to the client, which allows remote attackers to
download and display arbitrary MPEG movie files via (1) DNS spoofing,
(2) a URL on the command line, or (3) a URL in the configuration file.
NOTE: the same attack vectors apply to common web browsers that are
able to communicate with untrusted web servers, and other problems
related to DNS design issues.  Therefore this may not be a specific
vulnerability.  However, a client would reasonably expect to receive
content only from the server.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

to 1.4.5 allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS)
attacks via style sheet specifiers with invalid (1) "/*" and "*/"
comments, or (2) a newline in a "url" specifier, which is processed by
certain web browsers including Internet Explorer.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-0800
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-0800
Phase: Assigned (20060220)
Category: 
Reference: FULLDISC:20060219 Multiple vulnerabilities in PostNuke <= 0.761
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/fulldisclosure/2006-02/0469.html
Reference: MISC:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/454
Reference: CONFIRM:http://news.postnuke.com/index.php?name=News&file=article&sid=2754
Reference: BID:16752
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/16752
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2006-0673
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/0673
Reference: SECUNIA:18937
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/18937
Reference: SREASON:454
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/454
Reference: XF:postnuke-user-nslanguages-xss(24823)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/24823

Interpretation conflict in PostNuke 0.761 and earlier allows remote
attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via HTML tags
with a trailing "<" character, which is interpreted as a ">" character
by some web browsers but bypasses the blacklist protection in (1) the
pnVarCleanFromInput function in pnAPI.php, (2) the pnSecureInput
function in pnAntiCracker.php, and (3) the htmltext parameter in an
edituser operation to user.php.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Bugzilla 2.19.3 through 2.20 does not properly handle "//" sequences
in URLs when redirecting a user from the login form, which could cause
it to generate a partial URL in a form action that causes the user's
browser to send the form data to another domain.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-0917
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-0917
Phase: Assigned (20060228)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060221 grab cookie information with Melange Chat Server 1.10
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/425589/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.oh2600.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=43
Reference: BID:16747
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/16747
Reference: SECUNIA:18984
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/18984
Reference: SREASON:463
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/463
Reference: XF:melange-chat-command-information-disclosure(24868)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/24868

Melange Chat Server (aka M-Chat), when accessed via a web browser,
automatically sends cookies and other sensitive information for a
server to any port specified in the associated link, which allows
local users on that server to read the cookies from HTTP headers and
possibly gain sensitive information, such as credentials, by setting
up a listening port and reading the credentials when the victim clicks
on the link.

The on-access scanner for McAfee Virex 7.7 for Macintosh, in some
circumstances, might not activate when malicious content is accessed
from the web browser, and might not prevent the content from being
saved, which allows remote attackers to bypass virus protection, as
demonstrated using the EICAR test file.

======================================================

Name: CVE-2006-2055
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-2055
Phase: Assigned (20060426)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060424 Multiple browsers Windows mailto protocol Office 2003 file attachment exploit
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/432009/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://ingehenriksen.blogspot.com/2006/04/office-2003-file-attachment-exploit.html
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2006-1538
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/1538
Reference: OSVDB:25003
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/25003
Reference: SECUNIA:19819
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/19819
Reference: XF:office-mailto-obtain-information(26118)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/26118

Argument injection vulnerability in Microsoft Outlook 2003 SP1 allows
user-assisted remote attackers to modify command line arguments to an
invoked mail client via " (double quote) characters in a mailto:
scheme handler, as demonstrated by launching Microsoft Outlook with an
arbitrary filename as an attachment.  NOTE: it is not clear whether
this issue is implementation-specific or a problem in the Microsoft
API.

Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060616 Re: Several flaws in e-business designer (eBD)
Reference: URL:http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=bugtraq&m=115047779610633&w=2

Reference: URL:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/2006-May/045980.html
Reference: MLIST:[ebd-devel] 20060502 actualizacin de seguridad
Reference: URL:http://lists.oasyssoft.com/ebd-devel/200605/msg00000.html
Reference: BID:17933
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/17933
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2006-1784
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/1784
Reference: SECTRACK:1016326
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1016326
Reference: SECUNIA:20071
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/20071
Reference: SREASON:891
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/891
Reference: XF:ebd-multiple-auth-bypass(26474)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/26474

E-Business Designer (eBD) 3.1.4 and earlier allows remote attackers to
upload or modify arbitrary files, and execute arbitrary code, via a
direct request to (1) common/html_editor/image_browser.upload.html,
(2) common/html_editor/image_browser.html, or (3)
common/html_editor/html_editor.html.  NOTE: this can also be used for
cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks by uploading cascading style sheet
(.CSS) files.

remote attackers to conduct spoofing and phishing attacks by using a
modal browser window in a way that preserves the original address bar
and trusted UI of a trusted site, even after the browser has been
navigated to a malicious site, aka the "Address Bar Spoofing
Vulnerability."

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/21631

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/21654

Reference: SECUNIA:27216
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27216
Reference: XF:mozilla-browserengine-memory-corruption(26843)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/26843

Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird before 1.5.0.4 allow remote attackers
to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary
code via (1) nested <option> tags in a select tag, (2) a
DOMNodeRemoved mutation event, (3) "Content-implemented tree views,"
(4) BoxObjects, (5) the XBL implementation, (6) an iframe that
attempts to remove itself, which leads to memory corruption.

Name: CVE-2006-2780

allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and
possibly execute arbitrary code via "jsstr tagify," which leads to
memory corruption.

Reference: SECUNIA:27383
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27383
Reference: SECUNIA:27403
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27403
Reference: SECUNIA:27387
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27387
Reference: SECUNIA:27298
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27298
Reference: SECUNIA:27414
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27414
Reference: SREASON:1059
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/1059

Mozilla Firefox 1.5.0.4, 2.0.x before 2.0.0.8, Mozilla Suite 1.7.13,
Mozilla SeaMonkey 1.0.2 and other versions before 1.1.5, and Netscape
8.1 and earlier allow user-assisted remote attackers to read arbitrary
files by tricking a user into typing the characters of the target
filename in a text box and using the OnKeyDown, OnKeyPress, and
OnKeyUp Javascript keystroke events to change the focus and cause
those characters to be inserted into a file upload input control,
which can then upload the file when the user submits the form.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2006-3227
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-3227
Phase: Assigned (20060626)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060621 Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/437948/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060621 Re: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/438049/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060621 Re: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/438051/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060622 Re: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/438066/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060623 RE: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/438154/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060623 Re: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/438163/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060626 RE: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/438359/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060626 Re: Bypassing of web filters by using ASCII
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/438358/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://ha.ckers.org/blog/20060621/us-ascii-xss-part-2
Reference: MISC:http://ha.ckers.org/blog/20060621/malformed-ascii-bypasses-filters/
Reference: OSVDB:28376
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/28376
Reference: XF:ie-ascii-encoded-web-filter-bypass(27288)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/27288

Interpretation conflict between Internet Explorer and other web
browsers such as Mozilla, Opera, and Firefox might allow remote
attackers to modify the visual presentation of web pages and possibly
bypass protection mechanisms such as content filters via ASCII
characters with the 8th bit set, which could be stripped by Internet
Explorer to render legible text, but not when using other browsers.
NOTE: there has been significant discussion about this issue, and as
of 20060625, it is not clear where the responsibility for this issue
lies, although it might be due to vagueness within the associated
standards.  NOTE: this might only be exploitable with certain
encodings.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2006-3291
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-3291
Phase: Assigned (20060628)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20060628 Access Point Web-browser Interface Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060628-ap.shtml
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#544484
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/544484
Reference: BID:18704
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/18704
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2006-2584
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/2584
Reference: OSVDB:26878
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/26878
Reference: SECTRACK:1016399
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1016399
Reference: SECUNIA:20860
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/20860
Reference: XF:cisco-ap-browser-unauth-access(27437)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/27437

The web interface on Cisco IOS 12.3(8)JA and 12.3(8)JA1, as used on
the Cisco Wireless Access Point and Wireless Bridge, reconfigures
itself when it is changed to use the "Local User List Only (Individual
Passwords)" setting, which removes all security and password
configurations and allows remote attackers to access the system.

Name: CVE-2006-3354

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (crash) by setting the Filter property of an
ADODB.Recordset ActiveX object to certain values multiple times, which
triggers a null dereference.

in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0 allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary
code by repeatedly setting the Image field of an Internet.HHCtrl.1
object to certain values, possibly related to improper escaping and
long strings.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-3456
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-3456
Phase: Assigned (20060707)
Category: 
Reference: IDEFENSE:20070509 Symantec Norton Internet Security 2006 COM Object Security ByPass Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=529
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.symantec.com/avcenter/security/Content/2007.05.09.html
Reference: BID:23822
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/23822
Reference: OSVDB:35075
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/35075
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2007-1751
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2007/1751
Reference: SECTRACK:1018031
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1018031
Reference: SECUNIA:25172
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/25172
Reference: XF:symantec-navopts-security-bypass(34200)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/34200

The Symantec NAVOPTS.DLL ActiveX control (aka
Symantec.Norton.AntiVirus.NAVOptions) 12.2.0.13, as used in Norton
AntiVirus, Internet Security, and System Works 2005 and 2006, is
designed for use only in application-embedded web browsers, which
allows remote attackers to "crash the control" via unspecified vectors
related to content on a web site, and place Internet Explorer into a
"defunct state" in which remote attackers can execute arbitrary code
in addition to other Symantec ActiveX controls, regardless of whether
they are marked safe for scripting.  NOTE: this CVE was inadvertently
used for an E-mail Auto-Protect issue, but that issue has been
assigned CVE-2007-3771.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-3471
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-3471
Phase: Assigned (20060710)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://browserfun.blogspot.com/2006/07/mobb-7-tableframeset.html
Reference: BID:18873
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/18873
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2006-2701
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/2701

Reference: XF:ie-tableframeset-appendchild-dos(27592)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/27592

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 on Windows XP allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (crash) via a table with a frameset as a
child, which triggers a null dereference, as demonstrated using the
appendChild method.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-3510

Explorer 6 on Windows 2000 allows remote attackers to cause a denial
of service (crash) via a series of operations that result in an
invalid length calculation when using SysAllocStringLen, then triggers
a buffer over-read.

Reference: XF:imanagecms-absolutepath-file-include(27875)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/27875

Multiple PHP remote file inclusion vulnerabilities in component.php in
iManage CMS 4.0.12 and earlier allow remote attackers to execute
arbitrary PHP code via a URL in the absolute_path parameter to (1)
articles.php, (2) contact.php, (3) displaypage.php, (4) faq.php, (5)
mainbody.php, (6) news.php, (7) registration.php, (8) whosOnline.php,
(9) components/com_calendar.php, (10) components/com_forum.php, (11)
components/minibb/index.php, (12) components/minibb/bb_admin.php, (13)
components/minibb/bb_plugins.php, (14) modules/mod_calendar.php, (15)
modules/mod_browser_prefs.php, (16) modules/mod_counter.php, (17)
modules/mod_online.php, (18) modules/mod_stats.php, (19)
modules/mod_weather.php, (20) themes/bizz.php, (21)
themes/default.php, (22) themes/simple.php, (23) themes/original.php,
(24) themes/portal.php, (25) themes/purple.php, and other unspecified
files.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

SeaMonkey before 1.0.3 allows scripts with the UniversalBrowserRead

Forms.ListBox.1 or (2) Forms.ListBox.1 object with the ListWidth
property set to (a) 0x7fffffff, which triggers an integer overflow
exception, or to (b) 0x7ffffffe, which triggers a null dereference.

Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2006/3069

WebCore in Apple Mac OS X 10.3.9 and 10.4 through 10.4.7 allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute

error" in WebKit, possibly due to a buffer overflow, as originally

Name: CVE-2006-4092
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-4092
Phase: Assigned (20060810)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060802 Simpliciti Locked Browser Jail Breakout Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/442058/100/100/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060822 Simpliciti Locked Browser Jail Breakout Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/444026/100/100/threaded
Reference: BID:19304
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/19304
Reference: SECUNIA:21321
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/21321
Reference: SREASON:1365
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/1365
Reference: XF:simpliciti-security-bypass(28224)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/28224

Simpliciti Locked Browser does not properly limit a user's actions to
ones within the intended Internet Explorer environment, which allows
local users to perform unauthorized actions by visiting a web site
that executes a JavaScript window.blur loop to remove focus from the
browser window, then pressing CTRL-SHIFT-ESC to invoke the Task
Manager.

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/21915

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/21939

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/21950
Reference: SECUNIA:22036
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22036
Reference: SECUNIA:22001
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22001
Reference: SECUNIA:22025
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22025
Reference: SECUNIA:22055
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22055
Reference: SECUNIA:22074
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22074
Reference: SECUNIA:22088
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22088
Reference: SECUNIA:22210
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22210
Reference: SECUNIA:22274
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22274
Reference: SECUNIA:22391
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22391
Reference: SECUNIA:22422
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22422
Reference: SECUNIA:22056
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22056
Reference: SECUNIA:22195
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22195
Reference: SECUNIA:24711
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/24711
Reference: SECUNIA:22066
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/22066

Concurrency vulnerability in Mozilla Firefox 1.5.0.6 and earlier
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and
possibly execute arbitrary code via multiple Javascript timed events
that load a deeply nested XML file, followed by redirecting the
browser to another page, which leads to a concurrency failure that
causes structures to be freed incorrectly, as demonstrated by (1)
ffoxdie and (2) ffoxdie3.  NOTE: it has been reported that Netscape
8.1 and K-Meleon 1.0.1 are also affected by ffoxdie.  Mozilla
confirmed to CVE that ffoxdie and ffoxdie3 trigger the same underlying
vulnerability.  NOTE: it was later reported that Firefox 2.0 RC2 and
1.5.0.7 are also affected.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================

The Nokia Browser, possibly Nokia Symbian 60 Browser 3rd edition,
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via
JavaScript that constructs a large Unicode string.
