======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-4548
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-4548
Phase: Assigned (20060905)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060829 e107 <= 0.75 GLOBALS[] overwrite/Zend_Hash_Del_Key_Or_Index remote commands execution
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/444644/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://retrogod.altervista.org/e107_075_xpl.html
Reference: SREASON:1497
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/1497

e107 0.75 and earlier does not properly unset variables when the input
data includes a numeric parameter with a value matching an
alphanumeric parameter's hash value, which allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary PHP code via the tinyMCE_imglib_include image/jpeg
parameter in e107_handlers/tiny_mce/plugins/ibrowser/ibrowser.php, as
demonstrated by a multipart/form-data request.  NOTE: it could be
argued that this vulnerability is due to a bug in the unset PHP
command (CVE-2006-3017) and the proper fix should be in PHP; if so,
then this should not be treated as a vulnerability in e107.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-4560
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-4560
Phase: Assigned (20060905)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060814 (somewhat) breaking the same-origin policy by undermining dns-pinning
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/443209/100/200/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://polyboy.net/xss/dnsslurp.html
Reference: MISC:http://shampoo.antville.org/stories/1451301/
Reference: OSVDB:31329
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/31329

Internet Explorer 6 on Windows XP SP2 allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary JavaScript in the context of the browser's session
with an arbitrary intranet web server, by hosting script on an
Internet web server that can be made inaccessible by the attacker and
that has a domain name under the attacker's control, which can force
the browser to drop DNS pinning and perform a new DNS query for the
domain name after the script is already running.

CRLF injection vulnerability in Adobe Flash Player plugin 9.0.16 and
earlier for Windows, 7.0.63 and earlier for Linux, 7.x before 7.0 r67
for Solaris, and before 9.0.28.0 for Mac OS X, allows remote attackers
to modify HTTP headers of client requests and conduct HTTP Request
Splitting attacks via CRLF sequences in arguments to the ActionScript
functions (1) XML.addRequestHeader and (2) XML.contentType.  NOTE: the
flexibility of the attack varies depending on the type of web browser
being used.

mod_status module in Apache HTTP Server (httpd), when ExtendedStatus
is enabled and a public server-status page is used, allows remote
attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified
vectors involving charsets with browsers that perform "charset
detection" when the content-type is not specified.

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/30129

SSL VPN Client in Cisco Secure Desktop before 3.1.1.45, when
configured to spawn a web browser after a successful connection,
stores sensitive browser session information in a directory outside of
the CSD vault and does not restrict the user from saving files outside
of the vault, which is not cleared after the VPN connection terminates
and allows local users to read unencrypted data.

Stack consumption vulnerability in the KFILE JPEG (kfile_jpeg) plugin
in kdegraphics 3, as used by konqueror, digikam, and other KDE image
browsers, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack
consumption) via a crafted EXIF section in a JPEG file, which results
in an infinite recursion.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-6308
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-6308
Phase: Assigned (20061206)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20061204 Symantec LiveState Agent for Windows vulnerability - Local Privilege Escalation
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/453481/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20061205 RE: Symantec LiveState Agent for Windows vulnerability - Local Privilege Escalation
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/453551/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20061205 Re: Symantec LiveState Agent for Windows vulnerabi
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/453587/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20061205 Re: Symantec LiveState Agent for Windows vulnerability - Local Privilege Escalation
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/453569/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20061206 RE: Symantec LiveState Agent for Windows vulnerability - Local Privilege Escalation
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/453653/100/0/threaded
Reference: SECTRACK:1017332
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1017332
Reference: XF:symantec-shstart-privilege-escalation(30728)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/30728

** DISPUTED **

Symantec LiveState 7.1 Agent for Windows allows local users to gain
privileges by stopping the shstart.exe process and open "Web
Self-Service" from the system tray icon, which will open a browser
window running with elevated privileges.  NOTE: several third-party
researchers have noted that administrator privileges may be necessary
to terminate shstart.exe. If this is the case, then no privilege
escalation occurs, and this is not a vulnerability.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

arbitrary code by operating an FTP server that sends directory
listings with (1) long user names or (2) long group names.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-6982
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-6982
Phase: Assigned (20070207)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://3proxy.ru/0.5.3g/Changelog.txt
Reference: XF:3proxy-ntlm-information-disclosure(38205)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/38205

3proxy 0.5 to 0.5.2 does not offer NTLM authentication before basic
authentication, which might cause browsers with incomplete
RFC2616/RFC2617 support to use basic cleartext authentication even if
NTLM is available, which makes it easier for attackers to steal
credentials.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-6983
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-6983
Phase: Assigned (20070208)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://pridels0.blogspot.com/2006/06/multiple-browsers-information.html

Cross-domain vulnerability in MYweb4net Browser 3.8.8.0 allows remote
attackers to access restricted information from other domains via an
object tag with a data parameter that references a link on the
attacker's originating site that specifies a Location HTTP header that
references the target site, which then makes that content available
through the outerHTML attribute of the object, a similar vulnerability
to CVE-2006-3280.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-7066
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-7066
Phase: Assigned (20070227)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090725 DoS vulnerabilities in Internet Explorer
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/bugtraq/2009-07/0193.html
Reference: MISC:http://blogs.securiteam.com/index.php/archives/554
Reference: MISC:http://browserfun.blogspot.com/2006/07/mobb-30-orphan-object-properties.html
Reference: MISC:http://websecurity.com.ua/3130/
Reference: BID:19228
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/19228
Reference: OSVDB:27533
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/27533
Reference: XF:ie-deleted-frame-dos(28068)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/28068

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 on Windows XP SP2 allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) by creating an object
inside an iframe, deleting the frame by setting its location.href to
about:blank, then accessing a property of the object within the
deleted frame, which triggers a NULL pointer dereference.  NOTE: it
was later reported that 7.0.6000.16473 and earlier are also affected.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-7070
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-7070
Phase: Assigned (20070227)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20060725 Etomite CMS <= 0.6.1 'rfiles.php' remote command execution
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/441202/100/0/threaded
Reference: MILW0RM:2072
Reference: URL:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/2072
Reference: MISC:http://retrogod.altervista.org/etomite_061_cmd.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.etomite.org/forums/index.php?showtopic=5757&st=0&p=35605&#entry35605
Reference: BID:19157
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/19157
Reference: OSVDB:27543
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/27543
Reference: SECTRACK:1016593
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1016593
Reference: SECUNIA:21208
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/21208
Reference: SREASON:2326
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2326

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/27947

Unrestricted file upload vulnerability in
manager/media/ibrowser/scripts/rfiles.php in Etomite CMS 0.6.1 and
earlier allows remote attackers to upload and execute arbitrary files
via an nfile[] parameter with a filename that contains a .php
extension followed by a valid image extension such as .gif or .jpg,
then calling the rename function.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2006-7206
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-7206
Phase: Assigned (20070621)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://browserfun.blogspot.com/2006/07/mobb-29-adodbrecordset-nextrecordset.html
Reference: BID:19227
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/19227
Reference: OSVDB:27532
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/27532
Reference: XF:ie-adodbrecordset-dos(28066)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/28066

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 on Windows XP SP2 allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) by creating a
ADODB.Recordset object and making a series of calls to the
NextRecordset method with a long string argument, which causes an
"invalid memory access" in the SysFreeString function, a different
issue than CVE-2006-3510 and CVE-2006-3899.

The web portal interface in Citrix Access Gateway (aka Citrix Advanced
Access Control) before Advanced Edition 4.5 HF1 places a session ID in
the URL, which allows context-dependent attackers to hijack sessions
by reading "residual information", including the a referer log,
browser history, or browser cache.

Explorer, and Opera web browsers allows remote attackers to force the

the (1) FDF, (2) xml, and (3) xfdf AJAX request parameters, following

Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2090
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-2898
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2898
Reference: XF:adobe-acrobat-pdf-xss(31271)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/31271

Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Adobe Acrobat
Reader Plugin before 8.0.0, and possibly the plugin distributed with
Adobe Reader 7.x before 7.1.4, 8.x before 8.1.7, and 9.x before 9.2,
for Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 SP1, Google Chrome,
Opera 8.5.4 build 770, and Opera 9.10.8679 on Windows allow remote
attackers to inject arbitrary JavaScript and conduct other attacks via
a .pdf URL with a javascript: or res: URI with (1) FDF, (2) XML, and
(3) XFDF AJAX parameters, or (4) an arbitrarily named name=URI anchor
identifier, aka "Universal XSS (UXSS)."

2.0.0.2, and SeaMonkey before 1.0.8 uses the requesting URI to
identify child windows, which allows remote attackers to conduct
cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks by opening a blocked popup
originating from a javascript: URI in combination with multiple frames
having the same data: URI.

Reference: SREASON:2262
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2262
Reference: XF:firefox-locationhostname-security-bypass(32533)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/32533

Mozilla based browsers, including Firefox before 1.5.0.10 and 2.x
before 2.0.0.2, and SeaMonkey before 1.0.8, allow remote attackers to
bypass the same origin policy, steal cookies, and conduct other
attacks by writing a URI with a null byte to the hostname
(location.hostname) DOM property, due to interactions with DNS
resolver code.

Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.8 and SeaMonkey before 1.1.5 do not
properly implement JavaScript onUnload handlers, which allows remote
attackers to run certain JavaScript code and access the location DOM
hierarchy in the context of the next web site that is visited by a
client.

as a ChromeProtocol and can be loaded via JavaScript, which allows
remote attackers to obtain sensitive information by querying the
browser's session history.

Phase: Assigned (20070405)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20070404 Firefox extensions go Evil - Critical Vulnerabilities in Firefox/Firebug
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/464740/100/0/threaded

Reference: BID:23315
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/23315
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2007-1272
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2007/1272
Reference: SECUNIA:24743
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/24743
Reference: SREASON:2525
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2525
Reference: XF:firefox-firebug-console-security-bypass(33451)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/33451

Cross-zone scripting vulnerability in the DOM templates (domplates)
used by the console.log function in the Firebug extension before 1.03
for Mozilla Firefox allows remote attackers to bypass zone
restrictions, read arbitrary file:// URIs, or execute arbitrary code
in the browser chrome, as demonstrated via the runFile function,
related to lack of HTML escaping in the property name.

None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-1947
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-1947
Phase: Assigned (20070410)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20070406 Re: Firefox extensions go Evil - Critical Vulnerabilities in Firefox/Firebug

Cross-zone scripting vulnerability in the DOM templates (domplates)
used by the console.log function in the Firebug extension before 1.04
for Mozilla Firefox allows remote attackers to bypass zone
restrictions, read arbitrary file:// URIs, or execute arbitrary code
in the browser chrome by overwriting the toString function via a
certain function declaration, related to incorrect identification of
anonymous JavaScript functions, a different issue than CVE-2007-1878.

denial of service (browser crash) via a Thread subclass that calls
super.run from its run method.

the web browser but does not exit when administrative credentials are
missing, which allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary PHP code,
as demonstrated by a request to admin/create_engine.php followed by a
request to admin/generate_tabs.php.

Reference: SECUNIA:28135

Reference: SREASON:2781
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2781
Reference: XF:firefox-iframe-security-bypass(34701)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/34701

Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.5 does not prevent use of document.write
to replace an IFRAME (1) during the load stage or (2) in the case of
an about:blank frame, which allows remote attackers to display
arbitrary HTML or execute certain JavaScript code, as demonstrated by
code that intercepts keystroke values from window.event, aka the
"promiscuous IFRAME access bug," a related issue to CVE-2006-4568.

Reference: SECUNIA:25564
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/25564
Reference: SREASON:2781
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2781
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-1538
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/1538
Reference: XF:ie-pageupdate-security-bypass(34696)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/34696

Race condition in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 SP1; 6 and 7 for
Windows XP SP2 and SP3; 6 and 7 for Server 2003 SP2; 7 for Vista Gold,
SP1, and SP2; and 7 for Server 2008 SP2 allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code or perform other actions upon a page
transition, with the permissions of the old page and the content of
the new page, as demonstrated by setInterval functions that set
location.href within a try/catch expression, aka the "bait & switch
vulnerability" or "Race Condition Cross-Domain Information Disclosure
Vulnerability."

Reference: XF:mozilla-wyciwyg-security-bypass(35298)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/35298

Mozilla Firefox before 1.8.0.13 and 1.8.1.x before 1.8.1.5 does not
perform a security zone check when processing a wyciwyg URI, which
allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information, poison the
browser cache, and possibly enable further attack vectors via (1) HTTP
302 redirect controls, (2) XMLHttpRequest, or (3) view-source URIs.

Reference: SECUNIA:26258
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/26258
Reference: SECUNIA:26572
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/26572
Reference: SECUNIA:28179
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/28179
Reference: SECUNIA:28363
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/28363
Reference: XF:ie-firefoxurl-command-execution(35346)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/35346

Argument injection vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Explorer, when
running on systems with Firefox installed and certain URIs registered,
allows remote attackers to conduct cross-browser scripting attacks and
execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in a (1)
FirefoxURL or (2) FirefoxHTML URI, which are inserted into the command
line that is created when invoking firefox.exe.  NOTE: it has been
debated as to whether the issue is in Internet Explorer or Firefox.
As of 20070711, it is CVE's opinion that IE appears to be failing to
properly delimit the URL argument when invoking Firefox, and this
issue could arise with other protocol handlers in IE as well.
However, Mozilla has stated that it will address the issue with a
"defense in depth" fix that will "prevent IE from sending Firefox
malicious data."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2007-3924

Reference: MISC:http://sla.ckers.org/forum/read.php?3,13732,13739
Reference: SECUNIA:26082
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/26082

Argument injection vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Explorer, when
running on systems with Netscape installed and certain URIs
registered, allows remote attackers to conduct cross-browser scripting
attacks and execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in a
-chrome argument to the navigatorurl URI, which are inserted into the
command line that is created when invoking netscape.exe, a related
issue to CVE-2007-3670.  NOTE: there has been debate about whether the
issue is in Internet Explorer or Netscape. As of 20070713, it is CVE's
opinion that IE appears to not properly delimit the URL argument when
invoking Netscape; this issue could arise with other protocol handlers
in IE.

The check_logout function in class/auth.php in Help Center Live (hcl)
2.1.3a sends a redirect to the web browser but does not exit when

to delete administrative users and have other unspecified impact via
certain requests to (1) admin/departments.php, (2)
admin/operators.php, and other unspecified scripts.  NOTE: some of
these details are obtained from third party information.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-4424
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-4424
Phase: Assigned (20070818)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20070811 Safari for windows remote arbitry file upload
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/476675/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20070815 Re: Safari for windows remote arbitry file upload
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/476690/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20070820 Re: Re: Safari for windows remote arbitry file upload
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/477180/100/0/threaded
Reference: SECTRACK:1018575
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1018575
Reference: SREASON:3022
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/3022

Apple Safari for Windows 3.0.3 and earlier does not prompt the user
before downloading a file, which allows remote attackers to download
arbitrary files to the desktop of a client system via certain HTML, as
demonstrated by a filename in the DATA attribute of an OBJECT element.
NOTE: it could be argued that this is not a vulnerability because a
dangerous file is not actually launched, but as of 2007, it is
generally accepted that web browsers should prompt users before saving
dangerous content.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/3113
Reference: XF:apache-utf7-xss(36586)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/36586

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in mod_autoindex.c in the
Apache HTTP Server before 2.2.6, when the charset on a
server-generated page is not defined, allows remote attackers to
inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the P parameter using the
UTF-7 charset.  NOTE: it could be argued that this issue is due to a
design limitation of browsers that attempt to perform automatic
content type detection.

None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-4488
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-4488
Phase: Assigned (20070822)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20070821 SIEMENS Gigaset SE361 router XSS
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/477220/100/0/threaded
Reference: OSVDB:45841
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/45841
Reference: OSVDB:45842
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/45842
Reference: SREASON:3050
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/3050

Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the Siemens
Gigaset SE361 WLAN router with firmware 1.00.0 allow remote attackers
to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the portion of the URI
immediately following the filename for (1) a GIF filename, which
triggers display of the GIF file in text format and an unspecified
denial of service (crash); or (2) the login.tri filename, which
triggers a continuous loop of the browser attempting to visit the
login page.

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/36269

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Mayaa before 1.1.12 allows
remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML in certain
circumstances involving (1) lack of charset specification within a
META element or (2) a META element that specifies an unrecognized
charset, which trigger automatic character set recognition by the web
browser, as demonstrated by improper handling of UTF-7 data.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-4909
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-4909
Phase: Assigned (20070917)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20070913 WinSCP < 4.04 url protocol handler flaw
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/479298/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://winscp.cvs.sourceforge.net/winscp/winscp3/core/SessionData.cpp?r1=1.29&r2=1.30
Reference: CONFIRM:http://winscp.net/eng/docs/history/
Reference: BID:25655
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/25655
Reference: SECTRACK:1018697
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1018697
Reference: SECUNIA:26820
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/26820
Reference: SREASON:3141
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/3141
Reference: XF:winscp-scpsftp-command-execution(36591)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/36591

Interpretation conflict in WinSCP before 4.0.4 allows remote attackers
to perform arbitrary file transfers with a remote server via
file-transfer commands in the final portion of a (1) scp, and possibly
a (2) sftp or (3) ftp, URL, as demonstrated by a URL specifying login
to the remote server with a username of scp, which is interpreted as
an HTTP scheme name by the protocol handler in a web browser, but is
interpreted as a username by WinSCP.  NOTE: this is related to an
incomplete fix for CVE-2006-3015.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30780

Sun Java Runtime Environment (JRE) in JDK and JRE 6 Update 2 and
earlier, JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 12 and earlier, SDK and JRE 1.4.2_15
and earlier, and SDK and JRE 1.3.1_20 and earlier, when Firefox or
Opera is used, allows remote attackers to violate the security model
for JavaScript outbound connections via a multi-pin DNS rebinding
attack dependent on the LiveConnect API, in which JavaScript download
relies on DNS resolution by the browser, but JavaScript socket
operations rely on separate DNS resolution by a Java Virtual Machine
(JVM), a different issue than CVE-2007-5273.  NOTE: this is similar to
CVE-2007-5232.

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30507

The Adobe Macromedia Flash 9 plug-in allows remote attackers to cause
a victim machine to establish TCP sessions with arbitrary hosts via a
Flash (SWF) movie, related to lack of pinning of a hostname to a
single IP address after receiving an allow-access-from element in a
cross-domain-policy XML document, and the availability of a Flash
Socket class that does not use the browser's DNS pins, aka DNS
rebinding attacks, a different issue than CVE-2002-1467 and
CVE-2007-4324.

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27744
Reference: XF:mozilla-multiple-browser-code-execution(37281)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/37281

Multiple vulnerabilities in Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.8,
Thunderbird before 2.0.0.8, and SeaMonkey before 1.1.5 allow remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via crafted HTML that
triggers memory corruption or assert errors.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-5375
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-5375
Phase: Assigned (20071010)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://crypto.stanford.edu/dns/dns-rebinding.pdf
Reference: OSVDB:40930
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/40930

Interpretation conflict in the Sun Java Virtual Machine (JVM) allows
user-assisted remote attackers to conduct a multi-pin DNS rebinding
attack and execute arbitrary JavaScript in an intranet context, when
an intranet web server has an HTML document that references a
"mayscript=true" Java applet through a local relative URI, which may
be associated with different IP addresses by the browser and the JVM.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

phpMyAdmin 2.11.1, when accessed by a browser that does not URL-encode

Reference: FULLDISC:20070606 Kevin Johnson BASE <= 1.3.6 authentication bypass
Reference: URL:http://lists.grok.org.uk/pipermail/full-disclosure/2007-June/063767.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://sourceforge.net/project/shownotes.php?group_id=103348&release_id=521723

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/25518
Reference: XF:base-basemain-security-bypass(34724)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/34724

Basic Analysis and Security Engine (BASE) before 1.3.8 sends a
redirect to the web browser but does not exit, which allows remote
attackers to bypass authentication via (1) base_main.php, (2)
base_qry_alert.php, and possibly other vectors.

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/28277
Reference: SECUNIA:27800
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27800
Reference: SECUNIA:27838
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27838
Reference: SECUNIA:27845
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27845
Reference: SECUNIA:28398
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/28398
Reference: SECUNIA:27855
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27855
Reference: SECUNIA:27979
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27979
Reference: SECUNIA:29164
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/29164
Reference: XF:firefox-jar-uri-xss(38356)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/38356

The jar protocol handler in Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.10 and
SeaMonkey before 1.1.7 retrieves the inner URL regardless of its MIME
type, and considers HTML documents within a jar archive to have the
same origin as the inner URL, which allows remote attackers to conduct
cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via a jar: URI.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: XF:mozilla-multiple-memcorrupt-code-execution(38643)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/38643

Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Mozilla Firefox before
2.0.0.10 and SeaMonkey before 1.1.7 allow remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via
unknown vectors that trigger memory corruption.

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/28398
Reference: SECUNIA:27855
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27855
Reference: SECUNIA:27979
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27979
Reference: SECUNIA:29164
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/29164
Reference: XF:mozilla-http-referer-spoofing(38644)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/38644

Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.10 and SeaMonkey before 1.1.7 sets the
Referer header to the window or frame in which script is running,
instead of the address of the content that initiated the script, which
allows remote attackers to spoof HTTP Referer headers and bypass
Referer-based CSRF protection schemes by setting window.location and
using a modal alert dialog that causes the wrong Referer to be sent.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-6017
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-6017
Phase: Assigned (20071119)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2007-101/
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.symantec.com/avcenter/security/Content/2008.02.29.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://seer.entsupport.symantec.com/docs/300471.htm
Reference: CONFIRM:http://support.veritas.com/docs/300471
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.symantec.com/avcenter/security/Content/2008.02.28.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://seer.support.veritas.com/docs/308669.htm
Reference: BID:28008
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/28008
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-0718
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/0718
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-2672
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/2672
Reference: SECTRACK:1019525
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1019525
Reference: SECUNIA:27885
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27885

The PVATLCalendar.PVCalendar.1 ActiveX control in pvcalendar.ocx in
the scheduler component in the Media Server in Symantec Backup Exec
for Windows Server (BEWS) 11d 11.0.6235 and 11.0.7170, and 12.0
12.0.1364, exposes the unsafe Save method, which allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (browser crash), or create or
overwrite arbitrary files, via string values of the (1) _DOWText0, (2)
_DOWText1, (3) _DOWText2, (4) _DOWText3, (5) _DOWText4, (6) _DOWText5,
(7) _DOWText6, (8) _MonthText0, (9) _MonthText1, (10) _MonthText2,
(11) _MonthText3, (12) _MonthText4, (13) _MonthText5, (14)
_MonthText6, (15) _MonthText7, (16) _MonthText8, (17) _MonthText9,
(18) _MonthText10, and (19) _MonthText11 properties. NOTE: the vendor
states "Authenticated user involvement required," but authentication
is not needed to attack a client machine that loads this control.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/38886

Multiple SQL injection vulnerabilities in Drupal and vbDrupal 4.7.x
before 4.7.9 and 5.x before 5.4 allow remote attackers to execute
arbitrary SQL commands via modules that pass input to the
taxonomy_select_nodes function, as demonstrated by the (1)
taxonomy_menu, (2) ajaxLoader, and (3) ubrowser contributed modules.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-6414
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-6414
Phase: Assigned (20071217)
Category: 
Reference: MILW0RM:4731
Reference: URL:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/4731
Reference: BID:26870
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/26870
Reference: SECUNIA:28064
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/28064
Reference: XF:adultscript-administrator-security-bypass(39034)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/39034

admin/administrator.php in Adult Script 1.6 and earlier sends a
redirect to the web browser but does not exit, which allows remote
attackers to bypass authentication and obtain administrative
credentials via a direct request.  NOTE: this can be leveraged for
arbitrary code execution through a request to
admin/videolinks_view.php.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-6652
Status: Candidate

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/39346

but does not exit, which allows remote attackers to conduct direct
static code injection attacks and execute arbitrary code via the
testo_0 parameter in a cpie admin action to index.php, which writes to
dati/generali/footer.dtb (aka the XCMS footer).

======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-6699
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-6699
Phase: Assigned (20080204)
Category: 
Reference: FULLDISC:20071225 AOL YGP Picture Editor YGPPicEdit.dll Multiple Buffer Overflows
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2007/Dec/0561.html
Reference: FULLDISC:20071227 Re: AOL YGP Picture Editor YGPPicEdit.dll Multiple Buffer Overflows
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2007/Dec/0574.html
Reference: BID:27026
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/27026
Reference: OSVDB:41198
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/41198
Reference: SECTRACK:1019143
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1019143

Multiple buffer overflows in the AIM PicEditor 9.5.1.8 ActiveX control
in YGPPicEdit.dll in AOL You've Got Pictures (YGP) Picture Editor
allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (browser crash)
via a long string in the (1) DisplayName, (2) FinalSavePath, (3)
ForceSaveTo, (4) HiddenControls, (5) InitialEditorScreen, (6) Locale,
(7) Proxy, and (8) UserAgent property values.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-0298
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-0298
Phase: Assigned (20080116)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080112 Safari 2 Denial of Service
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/486202/100/0/threaded

KHTML WebKit as used in Apple Safari 2.x allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (browser crash) via a crafted web page,
possibly involving a STYLE attribute of a DIV element.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-0350
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-0350
Phase: Assigned (20080117)
Category: 
Reference: MILW0RM:4884
Reference: URL:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/4884
Reference: CONFIRM:http://evilsentinel.altervista.org/forum/index.php?topic=49.0
Reference: BID:27227
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/27227
Reference: SECUNIA:28427
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/28427

admin/index.php in Evilsentinel 1.0.9 and earlier sends a redirect to
the web browser but does not exit, which allows remote attackers to
gain administrative privileges and make arbitrary configuration
changes.

The browser engine in Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.12, Thunderbird
before 2.0.0.12, and SeaMonkey before 1.1.8 allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly trigger memory
corruption via vectors related to the (1)
nsTableFrame::GetFrameAtOrBefore, (2)
nsAccessibilityService::GetAccessible, (3)
nsBindingManager::GetNestedInsertionPoint, (4)
nsXBLPrototypeBinding::AttributeChanged, (5)
nsColumnSetFrame::GetContentInsertionFrame, and (6)
nsLineLayout::TrimTrailingWhiteSpaceIn methods, and other vectors.

The JavaScript engine in Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.12, Thunderbird
before 2.0.0.12, and SeaMonkey before 1.1.8 allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly trigger memory
corruption via (1) a large switch statement, (2) certain uses of watch
and eval, (3) certain uses of the mousedown event listener, and other
vectors.

Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.12, Thunderbird before 2.0.0.12, and
SeaMonkey before 1.1.8 allows remote attackers to execute script
outside of the sandbox and conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks
via multiple vectors including the XMLDocument.load function, aka
"JavaScript privilege escalation bugs."

CRLF injection vulnerability in Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.12 allows
remote user-assisted web sites to corrupt the user's password store
via newlines that are not properly handled when the user saves a
password.

Reference: SECUNIA:30620
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30620

Directory traversal vulnerability in Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.12,
Thunderbird before 2.0.0.12, and SeaMonkey before 1.1.8, when using
"flat" addons, allows remote attackers to read arbitrary Javascript,
image, and stylesheet files via the chrome: URI scheme, as
demonstrated by stealing session information from sessionstore.js.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.12 and SeaMonkey before 1.1.8 allows
remote attackers to steal navigation history and cause a denial of
service (crash) via images in a page that uses designMode frames, which
triggers memory corruption related to resize handles.

Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-1793
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/1793/references
Reference: SECTRACK:1019434
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1019434
Reference: SECUNIA:28839
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/28839
Reference: SECUNIA:29049
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/29049
Reference: SECUNIA:28758
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/28758
Reference: SECUNIA:29167
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/29167
Reference: SECUNIA:29098
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/29098
Reference: SECUNIA:30327
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30327
Reference: SECUNIA:30620
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30620
Reference: XF:firefox-bmp-information-disclosure(40491)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/40491
Reference: XF:firefox-bmp-dos(40606)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/40606

modules/libpr0n/decoders/bmp/nsBMPDecoder.cpp in Mozilla Firefox
before 2.0.0.12, Thunderbird before 2.0.0.12, and SeaMonkey before
1.1.8 does not properly perform certain calculations related to the
mColors table, which allows remote attackers to read portions of
memory uninitialized via a crafted 8-bit bitmap (BMP) file that
triggers an out-of-bounds read within the heap, as demonstrated using
a CANVAS element; or cause a denial of service (application crash) via
a crafted 8-bit bitmap file that triggers an out-of-bounds read.
NOTE: the initial public reports stated that this affected Firefox in
Ubuntu 6.06 through 7.10.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Web Wiz RTE_file_browser.asp in, as used in Web Wiz Rich Text Editor
4.0, Web Wiz Forums 9.07, and Web Wiz Newspad 1.02, does not require
authentication, which allows remote attackers to list directories and
read files.  NOTE: this can be leveraged for listings outside the
configured directory tree by exploiting a separate directory traversal
vulnerability.

and earlier allow remote attackers to list arbitrary directories, and

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30327
Reference: SECUNIA:30620
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30620
Reference: SREASON:2781
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/2781

Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.12 and Thunderbird before 2.0.0.12 does
not properly manage a delay timer used in confirmation dialogs, which
might allow remote attackers to trick users into confirming an unsafe
action, such as remote file execution, by using a timer to change the
window focus, aka the "dialog refocus bug" or "ffclick2".


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

rendering future plain text files within the browser.

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/29167
Reference: SECUNIA:29567
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/29567
Reference: SECUNIA:30327
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30327
Reference: SECUNIA:30620
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30620

Gecko-based browsers, including Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.12 and
SeaMonkey before 1.1.8, modify the .href property of stylesheet DOM
nodes to the final URI of a 302 redirect, which might allow remote
attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy and read sensitive
information from the original URL, such as with Single-Signon systems.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

warning dialog if the entire contents of a web page are in a DIV tag
that uses absolute positioning, which makes it easier for remote
attackers to conduct phishing attacks.

Reference: URL:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/5332

Reference: CONFIRM:http://service.real.com/realplayer/security/07252008_player/en/
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#831457
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/831457
Reference: BID:28157
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/28157
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-0842
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/0842
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-2194
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/2194/references
Reference: SECTRACK:1019576
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1019576
Reference: SECTRACK:1020563
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1020563
Reference: SECUNIA:29315
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/29315
Reference: XF:realplayer-realaudioobjects-code-execution(41087)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/41087
Reference: XF:realplayer-realaudioobjects-bo(41087)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/41087

The RealAudioObjects.RealAudio ActiveX control in rmoc3260.dll in
RealNetworks RealPlayer Enterprise, RealPlayer 10, RealPlayer 10.5
before build 6.0.12.1675, and RealPlayer 11 before 11.0.3 build
6.0.14.806 does not properly manage memory for the (1) Console or (2)
Controls property, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code or cause a denial of service (browser crash) via a series of
assignments of long string values, which triggers an overwrite of
freed heap memory.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-1368
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-1368
Phase: Assigned (20080317)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080313 Rapid7 Advisory R7-0032: Microsoft Internet Explorer FTP Command Injection Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/489500/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.rapid7.com/advisories/R7-0032.jsp
Reference: BID:28208
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/28208
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-0870
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/0870
Reference: SECUNIA:29346
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/29346
Reference: SREASON:3750
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/3750

CRLF injection vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Explorer 5 and 6
allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary FTP commands via an
ftp:// URL that contains a URL-encoded CRLF (%0D%0A) before the FTP
command, which causes the commands to be inserted into an
authenticated FTP connection established earlier in the same browser
session, as demonstrated using a DELE command, a variant or possibly a
regression of CVE-2004-1166.  NOTE: a trailing "//" can force Internet
Explorer to try to reuse an existing authenticated connection.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-2139
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-2139
Phase: Assigned (20080512)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://wiki.rpath.com/wiki/Advisories:rPSA-2008-0148
Reference: XF:rootpw-rpath-appliance-csrf(42393)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/42393
Reference: XF:rootpw-rpath-appliance-privilege-escalation(42394)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/42394

The rootpw plugin in rPath Appliance Platform Agent 2 and 3 does not
re-validate requests from a browser with a valid administrator
session, including requests to change the password, which makes it
easier for physically proximate attackers to gain privileges and
maintain control over the administrator account.

Unspecified versions of Microsoft Outlook Web Access (OWA) use the
Cache-Control: no-cache HTTP directive instead of no-store, which
might cause web browsers that follow RFC-2616 to cache sensitive
information.

The InstallShield Update Service Agent ActiveX control in isusweb.dll
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory
corruption and browser crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via
a call to ExecuteRemote with a URL that results in a 404 error
response.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the Flex 3
History Management feature in Adobe Flex 3.0.1 SDK and Flex Builder 3,
and generated applications, allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary
web script or HTML via the anchor identifier to (1)
client-side-detection-with-history/history/historyFrame.html, (2)
express-installation-with-history/history/historyFrame.html, or (3)
no-player-detection-with-history/history/historyFrame.html in
templates/html-templates/.  NOTE: Firefox 2.0 and possibly other
browsers prevent exploitation.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-2690
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-2690
Phase: Assigned (20080613)
Category: 
Reference: SECUNIA:30290

Reference: XF:browsercrm-bcrmpubroot-file-include(42922)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/42922

Multiple PHP remote file inclusion vulnerabilities in BrowserCRM
5.002.00, when register_globals is enabled, allow remote attackers to
execute arbitrary PHP code via a URL in the bcrm_pub_root parameter to
(1) kb.php, (2) login.php, (3) index.php, (4) contact_view.php, and
(5) contact.php in pub/, different vectors than CVE-2008-2689.  NOTE:
the provenance of this information is unknown; the details are
obtained solely from third party information.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-2742
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-2742
Phase: Assigned (20080617)
Category: 
Reference: MILW0RM:5770
Reference: URL:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/5770
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.achievo.org/blog/archives/631-Achievo-1.3.3-Security-Release.html
Reference: BID:29621
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/29621
Reference: SECUNIA:30597
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30597
Reference: XF:achievo-config-file-upload(42980)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/42980

Unrestricted file upload in the mcpuk file editor
(atk/attributes/fck/editor/filemanager/browser/mcpuk/connectors/php/config.php)
in Achievo 1.2.0 through 1.3.2 allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code by uploading a file with .php followed by a safe
extension, then accessing it via a direct request to the file in the
Achievo root directory.  NOTE: this is only a vulnerability in
environments that support multiple extensions, such as Apache with the
mod_mime module enabled.

Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-0977

Reference: XF:mozilla-altnames-spoofing(43524)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/43524

Mozilla 1.9 M8 and earlier, Mozilla Firefox 2 before 2.0.0.15,
SeaMonkey 1.1.5 and other versions before 1.1.10, Netscape 9.0, and
other Mozilla-based web browsers, when a user accepts an SSL server
certificate on the basis of the CN domain name in the DN field, regard
the certificate as also accepted for all domain names in
subjectAltName:dNSName fields, which makes it easier for remote
attackers to trick a user into accepting an invalid certificate for a
spoofed web site.

Category:

Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2008-7467

Reference: BID:30689
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/30689
Reference: SECUNIA:31462
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31462
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-2392

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31825
Reference: XF:drupal-mimemedia-xss(44446)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/44446

The private filesystem in Drupal 5.x before 5.10 and 6.x before 6.4
trusts the MIME type sent by a web browser, which allows remote
authenticated users to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks by
uploading files containing arbitrary web script or HTML.

Reference: BID:30934
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/30934
Reference: BID:29503
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/29503
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-2466
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/2466
Reference: SECUNIA:31707
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31707
Reference: SECUNIA:31708
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31708
Reference: SECUNIA:31709
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31709
Reference: SECUNIA:31710
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31710
Reference: SREASON:4202
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/4202
Reference: XF:vmware-comapi-guestinfo-bo(43062)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/43062

Buffer overflow in a certain ActiveX control in the COM API in VMware
Workstation 5.5.x before 5.5.8 build 108000, VMware Workstation 6.0.x
before 6.0.5 build 109488, VMware Player 1.x before 1.0.8 build
108000, VMware Player 2.x before 2.0.5 build 109488, VMware ACE 1.x
before 1.0.7 build 108880, VMware ACE 2.x before 2.0.5 build 109488,
and VMware Server before 1.0.7 build 108231 allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (browser crash) or possibly execute
arbitrary code via a call to the GuestInfo method in which there is a
long string argument, and an assignment of a long string value to the
result of this call.  NOTE: this may overlap CVE-2008-3691,
CVE-2008-3692, CVE-2008-3693, CVE-2008-3694, CVE-2008-3695, or
CVE-2008-3696.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-3950
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-3950
Phase: Assigned (20080905)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080912 CORE-2008-0126: iPhone Safari JavaScript alert Denial of Service
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/496321/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.coresecurity.com/content/iphone-safari-javascript-alert-denial-of-service
Reference: BID:31061
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/31061
Reference: SREASON:4264
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/4264

Off-by-one error in the
_web_drawInRect:withFont:ellipsis:alignment:measureOnly function in
WebKit in Safari in Apple iPhone 1.1.4 and 2.0 and iPod touch 1.1.4
and 2.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (browser
crash) via a JavaScript alert call with an argument that lacks
breakable characters and has a length that is a multiple of the memory
page size, leading to an out-of-bounds read.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2008-4110
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-4110
Phase: Assigned (20080916)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080911 sqlvdir.dll ActiveX Remote Buffer Overflow Exploit
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/496232/100/0/threaded
Reference: BID:31129
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/31129
Reference: SREASON:4262
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/4262
Reference: XF:mssql-sqlvdir-bo(45186)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/45186

Buffer overflow in the SQLVDIRLib.SQLVDirControl ActiveX control in
Tools\Binn\sqlvdir.dll in Microsoft SQL Server 2000 (aka SQL Server
8.0) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (browser
crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a long URL in the second
argument to the Connect method.  NOTE: this issue is not a
vulnerability in many environments, since the control is not marked as
safe for scripting and would not execute with default Internet
Explorer settings.

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31930

Reference: XF:proftpd-url-csrf(45274)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/45274

ProFTPD 1.3.1 interprets long commands from an FTP client as multiple
commands, which allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site request
forgery (CSRF) attacks and execute arbitrary FTP commands via a long
ftp:// URI that leverages an existing session from the FTP client
implementation in a web browser.

ftpd in OpenBSD 4.3, FreeBSD 7.0, NetBSD 4.0, Solaris, and possibly
other operating systems interprets long commands from an FTP client as
multiple commands, which allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site
request forgery (CSRF) attacks and execute arbitrary FTP commands via
a long ftp:// URI that leverages an existing session from the FTP
client implementation in a web browser.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-4325
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-4325
Phase: Assigned (20080930)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20080919 viewvc security flaw?
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2008/09/19/4
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20080920 Re: viewvc security flaw?
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2008/09/20/1
Reference: CONFIRM:http://viewvc.tigris.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=354
Reference: CONFIRM:http://viewvc.tigris.org/source/browse/viewvc/trunk/lib/viewvc.py?rev=2011&r1=1968&r2=1978
Reference: CONFIRM:http://viewvc.tigris.org/source/browse/viewvc?rev=1978&view=rev
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2008-8252
Reference: URL:https://www.redhat.com/archives/fedora-package-announce/2008-September/msg01101.html
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2008-8270
Reference: URL:https://www.redhat.com/archives/fedora-package-announce/2008-September/msg01142.html

lib/viewvc.py in ViewVC 1.0.5 uses the content-type parameter in the
HTTP request for the Content-Type header in the HTTP response, which
allows remote attackers to cause content to be misinterpreted by the
browser via a content-type parameter that is inconsistent with the
requested object.  NOTE: this issue might not be a vulnerability, since
it requires attacker access to the repository that is being viewed.

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/497831/100/0/threaded
Reference: MILW0RM:6491
Reference: URL:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/6491
Reference: MISC:http://retrogod.altervista.org/9sg_numedia_xpl.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.shinnai.net/xplits/TXT_TrWE9AJA8nQpuFsnxBcq
Reference: BID:31374
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/31374
Reference: SECUNIA:32455
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/32455
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-2663
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/2663
Reference: SECUNIA:31936
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31936
Reference: SECUNIA:31949
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31949
Reference: SECUNIA:31950
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31950
Reference: XF:nmsdvdburning-nmsdvdx-file-overwrite(45330)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/45330

NuMedia Soft NMS DVD Burning SDK Activex NMSDVDX.DVDEngineX.1 ActiveX
control (NMSDVDX.dll) 1.013C and earlier, as used in CDBurnerXP
4.2.1.976, BurnAware 2.1.3, Blaze Media Pro 8.02 Special Edition, and
possibly other products, allows remote attackers to overwrite and
create arbitrary files via calls to the EnableLog and LogMessage
methods. NOTE: this issue might only be exploitable in limited
environments or non-default browser settings. NOTE: some of these
details are obtained from third party information. NOTE: this can be
leveraged for remote code execution by accessing files using hcp://
URLs.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2008-4343
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-4343
Phase: Assigned (20080930)
Category: 
Reference: MILW0RM:6537
Reference: URL:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/6537

Reference: XF:chilkatxml-chilkatutil-file-overwrite(45333)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/45333

The Chilkat XML ChilkatUtil.CkData.1 ActiveX control (ChilkatUtil.dll)
3.0.3.0 and earlier allows remote attackers to create, overwrite, and
modify arbitrary files for execution via a call to the (1) SaveToFile,
(2) SaveToTempFile, or (3) AppendBinary method.  NOTE: this issue might
only be exploitable in limited environments or non-default browser
settings.  NOTE: this can be leveraged for remote code execution by
accessing files using hcp:// URLs.

Adobe Flash Player before 9.0.277.0 and 10.x before 10.1.53.64, and
Adobe AIR before 2.0.2.12610, allows remote web servers to cause a
denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and browser crash) by
returning a different response when an HTTP request is sent a second
time, as demonstrated by two responses that provide SWF files with
different SWF version numbers.

Name: CVE-2008-4800
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-4800
Phase: Assigned (20081030)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20081030 DebugDiag (CrashHangExt.dll 1.0) NULL Pointer Dereference
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/497943/100/0/threaded
Reference: BID:31996
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/31996
Reference: SREASON:4532
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/4532
Reference: XF:debugdiagnostic-debugdiag-dos(46309)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/46309

The DebugDiag ActiveX control in CrashHangExt.dll, possibly 1.0, in
Microsoft Debug Diagnostic Tool allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and Internet Explorer 6.0
crash) via a large negative integer argument to the
GetEntryPointForThread method.  NOTE: this issue might only be
exploitable in limited environments or non-default browser settings.

Uploader PRO), when magic_quotes_gpc is disabled, allow remote

Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-0977
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/0977
Reference: XF:mozilla-xmlhttprequest-302-info-disclosure(47412)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47412

Mozilla Firefox 3.x before 3.0.5 and 2.x before 2.0.0.19, Thunderbird
2.x before 2.0.0.19, and SeaMonkey 1.x before 1.1.14 allows remote
attackers to bypass the same origin policy by causing the browser to
issue an XMLHttpRequest to an attacker-controlled resource that uses a
302 redirect to a resource in a different domain, then reading content
from the response, aka "response disclosure."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-5821
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5821
Phase: Assigned (20090102)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://jbrownsec.blogspot.com/2008/12/new-year-research-are-upon-us.html

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/33080
Reference: XF:apple-safari-alink-dos(47724)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/47724

Memory leak in WebKit.dll in WebKit, as used by Apple Safari 3.2 on
Windows Vista SP1, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of
service (memory consumption and browser crash) via a long ALINK
attribute in a BODY element in an HTML document.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-5912
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5912
Phase: Assigned (20090120)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20090113-new-method-of-phishmongering-could-fool-experienced-users.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.darkreading.com/security/attacks/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=212900161
Reference: MISC:http://www.infoworld.com/article/09/01/13/Browser_bug_could_allow_phishing_without_email_1.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.trusteer.com/files/In-session-phishing-advisory-2.pdf
Reference: BID:33276
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/33276
Reference: XF:multiple-browser-js-weak-security(48173)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/48173

An unspecified function in the JavaScript implementation in Microsoft
Internet Explorer creates and exposes a "temporary footprint" when
there is a current login to a web site, which makes it easier for
remote attackers to trick a user into acting upon a spoofed pop-up
message, aka an "in-session phishing attack." NOTE: as of 20090116,
the only disclosure is a vague pre-advisory with no actionable
information. However, because it is from a well-known researcher, it
is being assigned a CVE identifier for tracking purposes.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: BID:33276
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/33276
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:11139
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:11139
Reference: SECUNIA:40326
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/40326
Reference: SECUNIA:40401
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/40401
Reference: SECUNIA:40481
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/40481
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-1551
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/1551
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-1557
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/1557
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-1640
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/1640
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-1773
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/1773
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-1592
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/1592

The Math.random function in the JavaScript implementation in Mozilla
Firefox 3.5.x before 3.5.10 and 3.6.x before 3.6.4, and SeaMonkey
before 2.0.5, uses a random number generator that is seeded only once
per browser session, which makes it easier for remote attackers to
track a user, or trick a user into acting upon a spoofed pop-up
message, by calculating the seed value, related to a "temporary
footprint" and an "in-session phishing attack."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: XF:falt4-fckeditor-file-upload(48769)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/48769

Unrestricted file upload vulnerability in
editor/filemanager/browser/default/connectors/php/connector.php in
FCKeditor 2.2, as used in Falt4 CMS, Nuke ET, and other products,
allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by creating a file
with PHP sequences preceded by a ZIP header, uploading this file via a
FileUpload action with the application/zip content type, and then
accessing this file via a direct request to the file in
UserFiles/File/, probably a related issue to CVE-2005-4094.  NOTE: some
of these details are obtained from third party information.

0.2.149.27 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(browser crash) via a URI with an invalid handler followed by a "%"
(percent) character, which triggers a buffer over-read, as
demonstrated using an "about:%" URI.

Reference: XF:google-chrome-titletag-dos(45039)

The tooltip manager (chrome/views/tooltip_manager.cc) in Google Chrome
0.2.149.29 Build 1798 and possibly other versions before 0.2.149.30
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption
or crash) via a tag with a long title attribute, which is not properly
handled when displaying a tooltip, a different vulnerability than
CVE-2008-6994.  NOTE: there is inconsistent information about the
environments under which this issue exists.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2008-7293
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-7293
Phase: Assigned (20110809)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://code.google.com/p/browsersec/wiki/Part2#Same-origin_policy_for_cookies
Reference: MISC:http://michael-coates.blogspot.com/2010/01/cookie-forcing-trust-your-cookies-no.html
Reference: MISC:http://scarybeastsecurity.blogspot.com/2008/11/cookie-forcing.html
Reference: MISC:http://scarybeastsecurity.blogspot.com/2011/02/some-less-obvious-benefits-of-hsts.html
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=660053
Reference: CONFIRM:http://hacks.mozilla.org/2010/08/firefox-4-http-strict-transport-security-force-https/

Mozilla Firefox before 4 cannot properly restrict modifications to
cookies established in HTTPS sessions, which allows man-in-the-middle
attackers to overwrite or delete arbitrary cookies via a Set-Cookie
header in an HTTP response, related to lack of the HTTP Strict
Transport Security (HSTS) includeSubDomains feature, aka a "cookie
forcing" issue.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-0090
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0090
Phase: Assigned (20090108)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS09-061

Microsoft .NET Framework 1.0 SP3, 1.1 SP1, and 2.0 SP1 does not
properly validate .NET verifiable code, which allows remote attackers
to obtain unintended access to stack memory, and execute arbitrary
code, via (1) a crafted XAML browser application (XBAP), (2) a crafted
ASP.NET application, or (3) a crafted .NET Framework application, aka
"Microsoft .NET Framework Pointer Verification Vulnerability."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-0374
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0374
Phase: Assigned (20090130)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090128 Advisory: Google Chrome 1.0.154.43 ClickJacking Vulnerability.
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/500499/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090128 Re: Advisory: Google Chrome 1.0.154.43 ClickJacking Vulnerability.
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/500533/100/0/threaded
Reference: MILW0RM:7903
Reference: URL:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/7903
Reference: MISC:http://www.secniche.org/gcr_clkj/

** DISPUTED **

Google Chrome 1.0.154.43 allows remote attackers to trick a user into
visiting an arbitrary URL via an onclick action that moves a crafted
element to the current mouse position, related to a "Clickjacking"
vulnerability.  NOTE: a third party disputes the relevance of this
issue, stating that "every sufficiently featured browser is and likely
will remain susceptible to the behavior known as clickjacking," and
adding that the exploit code "is not a valid demonstration of the
issue."

None (candidate not yet proposed)

and 10.x before 10.0.22.87 allows remote attackers to cause a denial
of service (browser crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a
crafted Shockwave Flash (aka .swf) file.

OWC10 or OWC11), as distributed in Office XP SP3 and Office 2003 SP3,
Office XP Web Components SP3, Office 2003 Web Components SP3, Office
2003 Web Components SP1 for the 2007 Microsoft Office System, Internet
Security and Acceleration (ISA) Server 2004 SP3 and 2006 Gold and SP1,
and Office Small Business Accounting 2006, when used in Internet
Explorer, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a
crafted call to the msDataSourceObject method, as exploited in the
wild in July and August 2009, aka "Office Web Components HTML Script
Vulnerability."

and the FeedWriter.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2069
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2069
Phase: Assigned (20090615)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=79323
Reference: MISC:http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/79323/pbp-final-with-update.pdf
Reference: BID:35411
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/35411

Microsoft Internet Explorer before 8 displays a cached certificate for
a (1) 4xx or (2) 5xx CONNECT response page returned by a proxy server,
which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof an arbitrary https
site by letting a browser obtain a valid certificate from this site
during one request, and then sending the browser a crafted 502
response page upon a subsequent request.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2072
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2072

Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=79323

Reference: BID:35411
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/35411

Apple Safari does not require a cached certificate before displaying a
lock icon for an https web site, which allows man-in-the-middle
attackers to spoof an arbitrary https site by sending the browser a
crafted (1) 4xx or (2) 5xx CONNECT response page for an https request
sent through a proxy server.

Name: CVE-2009-2281
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2281
Phase: Assigned (20090701)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20090701 Re: incorrect upstream fix for CVE-2009-0840 (mapserver)
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2009/07/01/1
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20090701 Re: incorrect upstream fix for CVE-2009-0840 (mapserver)
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2009/07/01/6
Reference: CONFIRM:http://security.debian.org/pool/updates/main/m/mapserver/mapserver_4.10.0-5.1+etch4.diff.gz
Reference: CONFIRM:http://security.debian.org/pool/updates/main/m/mapserver/mapserver_5.0.3-3+lenny4.diff.gz
Reference: CONFIRM:http://trac.osgeo.org/mapserver/browser/tags/rel-5-4-2/mapserver/HISTORY.TXT
Reference: CONFIRM:http://trac.osgeo.org/mapserver/ticket/2943
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-1914
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2009/dsa-1914

Multiple heap-based buffer underflows in the readPostBody function in
cgiutil.c in mapserv in MapServer 4.x through 4.10.4 and 5.x before
5.4.2 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via (1) a
crafted Content-Length HTTP header or (2) a large HTTP request,
related to an integer overflow that triggers a heap-based buffer
overflow.  NOTE: this issue reportedly exists because of an incomplete
fix for CVE-2009-0840.

The browser engine in Mozilla Firefox before 3.0.12 and Thunderbird
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory
corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code
via vectors related to (1) the frame chain and synchronous events, (2)

nsCSSFrameConstructor::CreateFloatingLetterFrame, (3)
nsCSSFrameConstructor::ConstructFrame, (4) the child list and initial
reflow, (5) GetLastSpecialSibling, (6)
nsFrameManager::GetPrimaryFrameFor and MathML, (7)
nsFrame::GetBoxAscent, (8) nsCSSFrameConstructor::AdjustParentFrame,
(9) nsDOMOfflineResourceList, and (10)
nsContentUtils::ComparePosition.

Name: CVE-2009-2497
Status: Candidate

Phase: Assigned (20090717)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS09-061

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6510

The Common Language Runtime (CLR) in Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0, 2.0
SP1, 2.0 SP2, 3.5, and 3.5 SP1, and Silverlight 2, does not properly
handle interfaces, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code via (1) a crafted XAML browser application (XBAP), (2) a crafted
Silverlight application, (3) a crafted ASP.NET application, or (4) a
crafted .NET Framework application, aka "Microsoft Silverlight and
Microsoft .NET Framework CLR Vulnerability."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2504
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2504
Phase: Assigned (20090717)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS09-062

Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA09-286A.html
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6282
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6282

Multiple integer overflows in unspecified APIs in GDI+ in Microsoft
.NET Framework 1.1 SP1, .NET Framework 2.0 SP1 and SP2, Windows XP SP2
and SP3, Windows Server 2003 SP2, Vista Gold and SP1, Server 2008
Gold, Office XP SP3, Office 2003 SP3, 2007 Microsoft Office System SP1
and SP2, Office Project 2002 SP1, Visio 2002 SP2, Office Word Viewer,
Word Viewer 2003 Gold and SP3, Office Excel Viewer 2003 Gold and SP3,
Office Excel Viewer, Office PowerPoint Viewer 2007 Gold, SP1, and SP2,
Office Compatibility Pack for Word, Excel, and PowerPoint 2007 File
Formats SP1 and SP2, Expression Web, Expression Web 2, Groove 2007
Gold and SP1, Works 8.5, SQL Server 2000 Reporting Services SP2, SQL
Server 2005 SP2 and SP3, Report Viewer 2005 SP1, Report Viewer 2008
Gold and SP1, and Forefront Client Security 1.0 allow remote attackers
to execute arbitrary code via (1) a crafted XAML browser application
(XBAP), (2) a crafted ASP.NET application, or (3) a crafted .NET
Framework application, aka "GDI+ .NET API Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2508
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2508
Phase: Assigned (20090717)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS09-070
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS09-070.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA09-342A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA09-342A.html
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5882
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5882

The single sign-on implementation in Active Directory Federation
Services (ADFS) in Microsoft Windows Server 2003 SP2 and Server 2008
Gold and SP2 does not properly remove credentials at the end of a
network session, which allows physically proximate attackers to obtain
the credentials of a previous user of the same web browser by using
data from the browser's cache, aka "Single Sign On Spoofing in ADFS
Vulnerability."

The web browser on the Sony PLAYSTATION 3 (PS3) allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and console
hang) via a large integer value for the length property of a Select
object, a related issue to CVE-2009-1692.

Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20091202 Same-origin policy bypass vulnerabilities in several VPN products reported
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/508164/100/0/threaded
Reference: FULLDISC:20060608 SSL VPNs and security
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2006/Jun/238
Reference: FULLDISC:20060609 Re: SSL VPNs and security
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2006/Jun/269
Reference: FULLDISC:20060609 Re: SSL VPNs and security
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2006/Jun/270
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.sonicwall.com/us/2123_14882.html

Reference: CONFIRM:http://support.nortel.com/go/main.jsp?cscat=BLTNDETAIL&DocumentOID=984744
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www116.nortel.com/pub/repository/CLARIFY/DOCUMENT/2009/50/025367-01.pdf
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#261869
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/261869
Reference: BID:37152
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/37152
Reference: SECTRACK:1023255
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1023255
Reference: SECUNIA:37696
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/37696
Reference: SECUNIA:37786
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/37786
Reference: SECUNIA:37788
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/37788
Reference: SECUNIA:37789
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/37789
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3567
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3567
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3568
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3568
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3569
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3569
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3570
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3570
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3571
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3571
Reference: XF:sslvpn-sameorigin-security-bypass(54523)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/54523

Multiple clientless SSL VPN products that run in web browsers,
including Stonesoft StoneGate; Cisco ASA; SonicWALL E-Class SSL VPN
and SonicWALL SSL VPN; SafeNet SecureWire Access Gateway; Juniper
Networks Secure Access; Nortel CallPilot; Citrix Access Gateway; and
other products, when running in configurations that do not restrict
access to the same domain as the VPN, retrieve the content of remote
URLs from one domain and rewrite them so they originate from the VPN's
domain, which violates the same origin policy and allows remote
attackers to conduct cross-site scripting attacks, read cookies that
originated from other domains, access the Web VPN session to gain
access to internal resources, perform key logging, and conduct other
attacks.  NOTE: it could be argued that this is a fundamental design
problem in any clientless VPN solution, as opposed to a
commonly-introduced error that can be fixed in separate
implementations. Therefore a single CVE has been assigned for all
products that have this design.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: XF:sun-jre-proxy-session-hijacking(52337)

The proxy mechanism implementation in Sun Java Runtime Environment
(JRE) in JDK and JRE 6 before Update 15, and JDK and JRE 5.0 before
Update 20, does not prevent access to browser cookies by untrusted (1)
applets and (2) Java Web Start applications, which allows remote
attackers to hijack web sessions via unspecified vectors.
