======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2945
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2945
Phase: Assigned (20090823)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://webauth.stanford.edu/security/2009-09-10.html
Reference: SECUNIA:36640
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/36640

weblogin/login.fcgi (aka the WebLogin login script) in Stanford
University WebAuth 3.5.5, 3.6.0, and 3.6.1 places passwords in URLs in
certain circumstances involving conversion of a POST request to a GET
request, which allows context-dependent attackers to discover
passwords by reading (1) web-server access logs, (2) web-server
Referer logs, or (3) the browser history.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 through 8 allows remote attackers to
spoof the address bar, via window.open with a relative URI, to show an
arbitrary URL on the web site visited by the victim, as demonstrated
by a visit to an attacker-controlled web page, which triggers a
spoofed login form for the site containing that page.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-3017
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-3017
Phase: Assigned (20090831)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090828 Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability in Mozilla, Firefox, SeaMonkey, Orca Browser and Maxthon
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/506163/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://websecurity.com.ua/3386/
Reference: XF:orca-browser-data-xss(53002)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/53002

Orca Browser 1.2 build 5 does not properly block data: URIs in Refresh
and Location headers in HTTP responses, which allows remote attackers
to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via vectors related to
(1) injecting a Refresh header that contains JavaScript sequences in a
data:text/html URI, (2) entering a data:text/html URI with JavaScript
sequences when specifying the content of a Refresh header, (3)
injecting a Location header that contains JavaScript sequences in a
data:text/html URI, or (4) entering a data:text/html URI with
JavaScript sequences when specifying the content of a Location header;
and does not properly handle javascript: URIs in HTML links within 302
error documents sent from web servers, which allows user-assisted
remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via
vectors related to (5) injecting a Location HTTP response header or
(6) specifying the content of a Location HTTP response header.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-3018
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-3018
Phase: Assigned (20090831)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090828 Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability in Mozilla, Firefox, SeaMonkey, Orca Browser and Maxthon
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/506163/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://websecurity.com.ua/3386/
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6524
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6524
Reference: XF:maxthon-browser-javascript-xss(53001)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/53001

Maxthon Browser 3.0.0.145 Alpha with Ultramode does not properly block
javascript: and data: URIs in Refresh headers in HTTP responses, which
allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks
via vectors related to (1) injecting a Refresh header that contains a
javascript: URI, (2) entering a javascript: URI when specifying the
content of a Refresh header, (3) injecting a Refresh header that
contains JavaScript sequences in a data:text/html URI, or (4) entering
a data:text/html URI with JavaScript sequences when specifying the
content of a Refresh header; does not properly block data: URIs in
Location headers in HTTP responses, which allows user-assisted remote
attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via vectors
related to (5) injecting a Location header that contains JavaScript
sequences in a data:text/html URI or (6) entering a data:text/html URI
with JavaScript sequences when specifying the content of a Location
header; and does not properly handle javascript: URIs in HTML links
within (a) 301 and (b) 302 error documents sent from web servers,
which allows user-assisted remote attackers to conduct cross-site
scripting (XSS) attacks via vectors related to (7) injecting a
Location HTTP response header or (8) specifying the content of a
Location HTTP response header.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2009-3166

Category:

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/36372
Reference: SECTRACK:1022902
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1022902
Reference: SECUNIA:36718
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/36718

token.cgi in Bugzilla 3.4rc1 through 3.4.1 places a password in a URL
at the beginning of a login session that occurs immediately after a
password reset, which allows context-dependent attackers to discover
passwords by reading (1) web-server access logs, (2) web-server
Referer logs, or (3) the browser history.

Reference: BID:36947
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/36947
Reference: OSVDB:59742
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/59742
Reference: SECUNIA:37273
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/37273
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3159
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3159
Reference: XF:google-chrome-warning-weak-security(54171)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/54171

Incomplete blacklist vulnerability in browser/download/download_exe.cc
in Google Chrome before 3.0.195.32 allows remote attackers to force
the download of certain dangerous files via a "Content-Disposition:
attachment" designation, as demonstrated by (1) .mht and (2) .mhtml
files, which are automatically executed by Internet Explorer 6; (3)
.svg files, which are automatically executed by Safari; (4) .xml
files; (5) .htt files; (6) .xsl files; (7) .xslt files; and (8) image
files that are forbidden by the victim's site policy.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Category:

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/38943

The gfxTextRun::SanitizeGlyphRuns function in
gfx/thebes/src/gfxFont.cpp in the browser engine in Mozilla Firefox
3.6 before 3.6.2 on Mac OS X, when the Core Text API is used, does not
properly perform certain deletions, which allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash)
and possibly execute arbitrary code via an HTML document containing
invisible Unicode characters, as demonstrated by the U+FEFF, U+FFF9,
U+FFFA, and U+FFFB characters.

Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.mozilla.org/security/announce/2010/mfsa2010-13.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=540642
Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2010:070
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2010:070
Reference: BID:38918
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/38918
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8711
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8711
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-0692
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/0692

The nsDocument::MaybePreLoadImage function in
content/base/src/nsDocument.cpp in the image-preloading implementation
in Mozilla Firefox 3.6 before 3.6.2 does not apply scheme restrictions
and policy restrictions to the image's URL, which might allow remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash or hang) or
hijack the functionality of the browser's add-ons via a crafted SRC
attribute of an IMG element, as demonstrated by remote command
execution through an ssh: URL in a configuration that supports
gnome-vfs with a nonstandard network.gnomevfs.supported-protocols
setting.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-0169
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0169
Phase: Assigned (20100106)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.mozilla.org/security/announce/2010/mfsa2010-14.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=535806
Reference: BID:38918
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/38918
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:11391
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:11391
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8431
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8431
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-0692
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/0692

The CSSLoaderImpl::DoSheetComplete function in
layout/style/nsCSSLoader.cpp in Mozilla Firefox 3.0.x before 3.0.18,
3.5.x before 3.5.8, and 3.6.x before 3.6.2; Thunderbird before 3.0.2;
and SeaMonkey before 2.0.3 changes the case of certain strings in a
stylesheet before adding this stylesheet to the XUL cache, which might
allow remote attackers to modify the browser's font and other CSS
attributes, and potentially disrupt rendering of a web page, by
forcing the browser to perform this erroneous stylesheet caching.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

before 2.0.4, executes a mail application in situations where an IMG
element has a SRC attribute that is a redirect to a mailto: URL, which
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive
application launches) via an HTML document with many images.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-0463
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0463
Phase: Assigned (20100129)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:https://secure.grepular.com/DNS_Prefetch_Exposure_on_Thunderbird_and_Webmail
Reference: CONFIRM:http://bugs.horde.org/ticket/8836
Reference: XF:horde-dns-info-disclosure(56052)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/56052

Horde IMP 4.3.6 and earlier does not request that the web browser
avoid DNS prefetching of domain names contained in e-mail messages,
which makes it easier for remote attackers to determine the network
location of the webmail user by logging DNS requests.

Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8654
Reference: SECTRACK:1023668
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1023668
Reference: SECUNIA:38727
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/38727
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-0485
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/0485
Reference: XF:ms-win-msgbox-code-execution(56558)

vbscript.dll in VBScript 5.1, 5.6, 5.7, and 5.8 in Microsoft Windows
2000 SP4, XP SP2 and SP3, and Server 2003 SP2, when Internet Explorer
is used, allows user-assisted remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code by referencing a (1) local pathname, (2) UNC share pathname, or
(3) WebDAV server with a crafted .hlp file in the fourth argument (aka
helpfile argument) to the MsgBox function, leading to code execution
involving winhlp32.exe when the F1 key is pressed, aka "VBScript Help
Keypress Vulnerability."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-0642
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0642
Phase: Assigned (20100217)
Category: 
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:11403
Reference: URL:http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/11403
Reference: BID:38202
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/38202
Reference: XF:ccs-files-information-disclosure(56221)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/56221

Cisco Collaboration Server (CCS) 5 allows remote attackers to read the
source code of JHTML files via URL encoded characters in the filename
extension, as demonstrated by (1) changing .jhtml to %2Ejhtml, (2)
changing .jhtml to .jhtm%6C, (3) appending %00 after .jhtml, and (4)
appending %c0%80 after .jhtml, related to the (a) doc/docindex.jhtml,
(b) browserId/wizardForm.jhtml, (c) webline/html/forms/callback.jhtml,
(d) webline/html/forms/callbackICM.jhtml, (e)
webline/html/agent/AgentFrame.jhtml, (f)
webline/html/agent/default/badlogin.jhtml, (g) callme/callForm.jhtml,
(h) webline/html/multichatui/nowDefunctWindow.jhtml, (i)
browserId/wizard.jhtml, (j) admin/CiscoAdmin.jhtml, (k)
msccallme/mscCallForm.jhtml, and (l)
webline/html/admin/wcs/LoginPage.jhtml components.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

WebKit before r52784, as used in Google Chrome before 4.0.249.78 and
Apple Safari before 4.0.5, permits cross-origin loading of CSS
stylesheets even when the stylesheet download has an incorrect MIME
type and the stylesheet document is malformed, which allows remote
attackers to obtain sensitive information via a crafted document.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1023506

Stack consumption vulnerability in the
ChildProcessSecurityPolicy::CanRequestURL function in
browser/child_process_security_policy.cc in Google Chrome before
4.0.249.78 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(memory consumption and application crash) via a URL that specifies
multiple protocols, as demonstrated by a URL that begins with many
repetitions of the view-source: substring.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-1099

Phase: Assigned (20100324)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20100323 Safari browser port blocking bypassed by integer overflow
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/510283/100/0/threaded
Reference: XF:safari-tcp-security-bypass(57233)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/57233

Integer overflow in Apple Safari allows remote attackers to bypass
intended port restrictions on outbound TCP connections via a port
number outside the range of the unsigned short data type, as
demonstrated by a value of 65561 for TCP port 25.

Name: CVE-2010-1164
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-1164
Phase: Assigned (20100329)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20100416 CVE Request: JIRA Issues
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2010/04/16/3
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20100416 Re: CVE Request: JIRA Issues
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2010/04/16/4

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/39353

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/57827

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/57826

Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Atlassian JIRA
3.12 through 4.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script
or HTML via the (1) element or (2) defaultColor parameter to the
Colour Picker page; the (3) formName parameter, (4) element parameter,
or (5) full name field to the User Picker page; the (6) formName
parameter, (7) element parameter, or (8) group name field to the Group
Picker page; the (9) announcement_preview_banner_st parameter to
unspecified components, related to the Announcement Banner Preview
page; unspecified vectors involving the (10) groupnames.jsp, (11)
indexbrowser.jsp, (12) classpath-debug.jsp, (13) viewdocument.jsp, or
(14) cleancommentspam.jsp page; the (15) portletKey parameter to
runportleterror.jsp; the (16) URI to issuelinksmall.jsp; the (17)
afterURL parameter to screenshot-redirecter.jsp; or the (18) HTTP
Referrer header to 500page.jsp, as exploited in the wild in April
2010.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-1206
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-1206
Phase: Assigned (20100330)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://lcamtuf.blogspot.com/2010/06/yeah-about-that-address-bar-thing.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/rev/cadddabb1178
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=556957
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.mozilla.org/security/announce/2010/mfsa2010-45.html
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8248
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:8248
Reference: SECUNIA:40283
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/40283

The startDocumentLoad function in browser/base/content/browser.js in
Mozilla Firefox 3.5.x before 3.5.11 and 3.6.x before 3.6.7, and
SeaMonkey before 2.0.6, does not properly implement the Same Origin
Policy in certain circumstances related to the about:blank document
and a document that is currently loading, which allows (1) remote web
servers to conduct spoofing attacks via vectors involving a 204 (aka
No Content) status code, and allows (2) remote attackers to conduct
spoofing attacks via vectors involving a window.stop call.

out-of-range arguments in the TraceRecorder::record_JSOP_ARGSUB

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-1898
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-1898
Phase: Assigned (20100511)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS10-060
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS10-060.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA10-222A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA10-222A.html
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12033
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12033

The Common Language Runtime (CLR) in Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 SP1,
2.0 SP2, 3.5, 3.5 SP1, and 3.5.1, and Microsoft Silverlight 2 and 3
before 3.0.50611.0 on Windows and before 3.0.41130.0 on Mac OS X, does
not properly handle interfaces and delegations to virtual methods,
which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via (1) a
crafted XAML browser application (aka XBAP), (2) a crafted ASP.NET
application, or (3) a crafted .NET Framework application, aka
"Microsoft Silverlight and Microsoft .NET Framework CLR Virtual Method
Delegate Vulnerability."

Reference: MISC:http://websecurity.com.ua/4206/

Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12386

Mozilla Firefox 3.6.x, 3.5.x, 3.0.19, and earlier, and SeaMonkey,
executes a mail application in situations where an IFRAME element has
a mailto: URL in its SRC attribute, which allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (excessive application launches) via an HTML
document with many IFRAME elements.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

files to be deleted, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial
of service (recursive file deletion) via unspecified vectors related
to a "logic flaw" in the CleanUploadFiles method in the nipplib.dll
module.

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/44443

The browser-plugin implementation in RealNetworks RealPlayer 11.0
through 11.1 and RealPlayer SP 1.0 through 1.1 allows remote attackers
to arguments to the RecordClip method, which allows remote attackers
to download an arbitrary program onto a client machine, and execute
this program, via a " (double quote) in an argument to the RecordClip
method, aka "parameter injection."

Name: CVE-2010-3934

URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-3934

Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.org/1009-exploits/blackberry-crossorigin.txt
Reference: SECTRACK:1024506
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1024506
Reference: SECUNIA:41536
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/41536

The browser in Research In Motion (RIM) BlackBerry Device Software
5.0.0.593 Platform 5.1.0.147 on the BlackBerry 9700 does not properly
restrict cross-domain execution of JavaScript, which allows remote
attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy via vectors related to a
window.open call and an IFRAME element.  NOTE: some of these details
are obtained from third party information.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-3958
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-3958
Phase: Assigned (20101014)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS11-028
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS11-028.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA11-102A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA11-102A.html
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12406
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12406

The x86 JIT compiler in Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 SP2, 3.5 SP1,
3.5.1, and 4.0 does not properly compile function calls, which allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via (1) a crafted XAML
browser application (aka XBAP), (2) a crafted ASP.NET application, or
(3) a crafted .NET Framework application, aka ".NET Framework Stack
Corruption Vulnerability."

Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[libcloud] 20100929 [jira] Closed: (LIBCLOUD-55) this python project is vulnerable to MITM as it fails to verify the ssl validity of the remote destination.
Reference: URL:http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/incubator-libcloud/201009.mbox/%3C5860913.463891285776633273.JavaMail.jira@thor%3E

libcloud before 0.4.1 does not verify SSL certificates for HTTPS
connections, which allows remote attackers to spoof certificates and
bypass intended access restrictions via a man-in-the-middle (MITM)
attack.

browser/extensions/theme_installed_infobar_delegate.cc in Google
Chrome before 8.0.552.224 and Chrome OS before 8.0.552.343 does not
properly handle incorrect tab interaction by an extension, which
allows user-assisted remote attackers to cause a denial of service

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/42648

8.0.552.224 and Chrome OS before 8.0.552.343 does not properly handle
certain postMessage calls, which allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via
crafted JavaScript code that creates a web worker.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-4729
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-4729
Phase: Assigned (20110208)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://code.zikula.org/core/ticket/1979
Reference: CONFIRM:http://code.zikula.org/core12/browser/tags/Zikula-1.2.5/src/docs/CHANGELOG

Zikula before 1.2.3 does not use the authid protection mechanism for
(1) the lostpassword form and (2) mailpasswd processing, which makes
it easier for remote attackers to generate a flood of password
requests and possibly conduct cross-site request forgery (CSRF)
attacks via multiple form submissions.

Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2011:120
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2011:1085
Reference: URL:http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/RHSA-2011-1085.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2011:0853
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2011-07/msg00016.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2011:0852
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2011-07/msg00015.html
Reference: BID:48619
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/48619
Reference: SECUNIA:45167
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/45167
Reference: SECUNIA:45224
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/45224

Integer signedness error in psaux/t1decode.c in FreeType before 2.4.6,
as used in CoreGraphics in Apple iOS before 4.2.9 and 4.3.x before
4.3.4 and other products, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application
crash) via a crafted Type 1 font in a PDF document, as exploited in
the wild in July 2011.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[rubyonrails-security] 20110209 CSRF Protection Bypass in Ruby on Rails

Reference: CONFIRM:http://weblog.rubyonrails.org/2011/2/8/csrf-protection-bypass-in-ruby-on-rails
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-2247
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2011/dsa-2247
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2011-2133
Reference: URL:http://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/package-announce/2011-March/055074.html
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2011-2138
Reference: URL:http://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/package-announce/2011-March/055088.html
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2011-4358
Reference: URL:http://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/package-announce/2011-April/057650.html
Reference: BID:46291
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/46291
Reference: SECTRACK:1025060
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1025060
Reference: SECUNIA:43274
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/43274
Reference: SECUNIA:43666
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/43666
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2011-0587
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0587
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2011-0877
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0877

Ruby on Rails 2.1.x, 2.2.x, and 2.3.x before 2.3.11, and 3.x before
3.0.4, does not properly validate HTTP requests that contain an
X-Requested-With header, which makes it easier for remote attackers to
conduct cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks via forged (1) AJAX
or (2) API requests that leverage "combinations of browser plugins and
HTTP redirects," a related issue to CVE-2011-0696.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Category: 
Reference: FULLDISC:20110201 Zikula CMS 1.2.4 <= Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF) Vulnerability

Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in the Users module in
Zikula before 1.2.5 allows remote attackers to hijack the
authentication of administrators for requests that change account
privileges via an edit access_permissions action to index.php.

Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS11-019.mspx
Reference: CERT:TA11-102A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA11-102A.html
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#323172
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/323172
Reference: BID:46360
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/46360
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12637
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12637
Reference: SECTRACK:1025328
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1025328
Reference: SECUNIA:43299
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/43299
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2011-0394
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0394
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2011-0938
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0938
Reference: XF:ms-win-server-browser-bo(65376)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/65376

Integer underflow in the BowserWriteErrorLogEntry function in the
Common Internet File System (CIFS) browser service in Mrxsmb.sys or
bowser.sys in Active Directory in Microsoft Windows XP SP2 and SP3,
Windows Server 2003 SP2, Windows Vista SP1 and SP2, Windows Server
2008 Gold, SP2, R2, and R2 SP1, and Windows 7 Gold and SP1 allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of
service (system crash) via a malformed BROWSER ELECTION message,
leading to a heap-based buffer overflow, aka "Browser Pool Corruption
Vulnerability." NOTE: some of these details are obtained from third
party information.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 SP1 and SP2, 3.5 Gold and SP1, 3.5.1, and
4.0, and Silverlight 4 before 4.0.60531.0, does not properly validate
arguments to unspecified networking API functions, which allows remote
attackers to execute arbitrary code via (1) a crafted XAML browser
application (aka XBAP), (2) a crafted ASP.NET application, (3) a
crafted .NET Framework application, or (4) a crafted Silverlight
application, aka ".NET Framework Array Offset Vulnerability."

The xsltGenerateIdFunction function in functions.c in libxslt 1.1.26
and earlier, as used in Google Chrome before 10.0.648.127 and other
products, allows remote attackers to obtain potentially sensitive
information about heap memory addresses via an XML document containing
a call to the XSLT generate-id XPath function.

Microsoft .NET Framework 1.0 SP3, 1.1 SP1, 2.0 SP2, 3.5.1, and 4, and

via (1) a crafted XAML browser application (aka XBAP), (2) a crafted

a crafted Silverlight application, aka ".NET Framework Class

======================================================
Name: CVE-2011-1271
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-1271
Phase: Assigned (20110304)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2135509/bug-only-occurring-when-compile-optimization-enabled/
Reference: MS:MS11-044
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS11-044.mspx
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12686
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12686

The JIT compiler in Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 Gold and SP1, 3.5.1,
and 4.0, when IsJITOptimizerDisabled is false, does not properly
handle expressions related to null strings, which allows
context-dependent attackers to bypass intended access restrictions,
and consequently execute arbitrary code, in opportunistic
circumstances by leveraging a crafted application, as demonstrated by
(1) a crafted XAML browser application (aka XBAP), (2) a crafted
ASP.NET application, or (3) a crafted .NET Framework application, aka
".NET Framework JIT Optimization Vulnerability."

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Pwn2Own competition at CanSecWest 2011.

Name: CVE-2011-1398
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-1398
Phase: Assigned (20110310)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[internals] 20120203 [PHP-DEV] The case of HTTP response splitting protection in PHP
Reference: URL:http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.php.devel/70584
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20120829 php header() header injection detection bypass
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/08/29/5
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20120905 Re: php header() header injection detection bypass
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/09/05/15
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=60227
Reference: CONFIRM:http://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-1398
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2013:1307
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2013-1307.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2013:1315
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2013-08/msg00006.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-1569-1
Reference: URL:http://www.ubuntu.com/usn/USN-1569-1
Reference: SECTRACK:1027463
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1027463
Reference: SECUNIA:55078
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/55078

The sapi_header_op function in main/SAPI.c in PHP before 5.3.11 and
5.4.x before 5.4.0RC2 does not check for %0D sequences (aka carriage
return characters), which allows remote attackers to bypass an HTTP
response-splitting protection mechanism via a crafted URL, related to
improper interaction between the PHP header function and certain
browsers, as demonstrated by Internet Explorer and Google Chrome.

Category: 
Reference: MS:MS11-069
Reference: URL:http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/Bulletin/MS11-069.mspx
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12901
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12901

Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 SP2, 3.5.1, and 4 does not properly
validate the System.Net.Sockets trust level, which allows remote
attackers to obtain sensitive information or trigger arbitrary
outbound network traffic via (1) a crafted XAML browser application
(aka XBAP), (2) a crafted ASP.NET application, or (3) a crafted .NET
Framework application, aka "Socket Restriction Bypass Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2011-2153
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-2153
Phase: Assigned (20110520)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/MORO-8GYQR4
Reference: MISC:http://xss.cx/examples/smarterstats-60-oscommandinjection-directorytraversal-xml-sqlinjection.html.html
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#240150
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/240150
Reference: XF:smarterstats-login-information-disclosure(67829)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/67829

Login.aspx in the SmarterTools SmarterStats 6.0 web server supports
URLs containing txtUser and txtPass parameters in the query string,
which makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to discover
credentials by reading (1) web-server access logs, (2) web-server
Referer logs, or (3) the browser history, related to a "cross-domain
Referer leakage" issue.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Phase: Assigned (20110602)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20110802 Android Browser Cross-Application Scripting (CVE-2011-2357)
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/519146/100/0/threaded
Reference: FULLDISC:20110802 Android Browser Cross-Application Scripting (CVE-2011-2357)
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2011/Aug/9
Reference: MISC:http://blog.watchfire.com/files/advisory-android-browser.pdf
Reference: MISC:http://blog.watchfire.com/wfblog/2011/08/android-browser-cross-application-scripting-cve-2011-2357.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.infsec.cs.uni-saarland.de/projects/android-vuln/
Reference: MISC:http://www.infsec.cs.uni-saarland.de/projects/android-vuln/android_xss.pdf
Reference: CONFIRM:http://android.git.kernel.org/?p=platform/cts.git;a=commit;h=7e48fb87d48d27e65942b53b7918288c8d740e17
Reference: CONFIRM:http://android.git.kernel.org/?p=platform/packages/apps/Browser.git;%20a=commit;h=096bae248453abe83cbb2e5a2c744bd62cdb620b
Reference: CONFIRM:http://android.git.kernel.org/?p=platform/packages/apps/Browser.git;%20a=commit;h=afa4ab1e4c1d645e34bd408ce04cadfd2e5dae1e
Reference: BID:48954
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/48954
Reference: OSVDB:74260
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/74260
Reference: SECTRACK:1025881
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1025881
Reference: SECUNIA:45457
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/45457
Reference: SREASON:8335
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/8335
Reference: XF:android-sandbox-cas(68937)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/68937

Cross-application scripting vulnerability in the Browser URL loading
functionality in Android 2.3.4 and 3.1 allows local applications to
bypass the sandbox and execute arbitrary Javascript in arbitrary
domains by (1) causing the MAX_TAB number of tabs to be opened, then
loading a URI to the targeted domain into the current tab, or (2)
making two startActivity function calls beginning with the targeted
domain's URI followed by the malicious Javascript while the UI focus
is still associated with the targeted domain.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/49055
Reference: XF:firefox-safety-bugs-ce(71908)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/71908

Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in Mozilla
Firefox 4.x through 8.0, Thunderbird 5.0 through 8.0, and SeaMonkey
before 2.6 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory
corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code
via vectors that trigger a compartment mismatch associated with the
nsDOMMessageEvent::GetData function, and unknown other vectors.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Category:

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/47090

Mozilla Firefox 8.0.1 and earlier does not prevent capture of data
about the times of Same Origin Policy violations during IFRAME loading
attempts, which makes it easier for remote attackers to determine
whether a document exists in the browser cache via crafted JavaScript
code.

Reference: XF:lanobasocial-index-xss(71411)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/71411

** DISPUTED **

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in
lanoba-social-plugin/index.php in the Lanoba Social plugin 1.0 for
WordPress allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or
HTML via the action parameter.  NOTE: the vendor disputes this issue,
stating "Lanoba's plug in does sanitize user input, and because that
input is never sent to the browser, an attacker has no way of
executing script or code on a user's behalf."

5.100.01 and earlier allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web
script or HTML via the PATH_INFO to (1) index.php, (2)

(4) index.php or (5) pub/clients.php; or framed parameter to (6)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2012-0014
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-0014
Phase: Assigned (20111109)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS12-016
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS12-016
Reference: CERT:TA12-045A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA12-045A.html
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:13972
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:13972

Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 SP2, 3.5.1, and 4, and Silverlight 4
before 4.1.10111, does not properly restrict access to memory
associated with unmanaged objects, which allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code via (1) a crafted XAML browser application (aka
XBAP), (2) a crafted ASP.NET application, (3) a crafted .NET Framework
application, or (4) a crafted Silverlight application, aka ".NET
Framework Unmanaged Objects Vulnerability."

before 3.6.28 and 4.x through 10.0, Firefox ESR 10.x before 10.0.3,
Thunderbird before 3.1.20 and 5.0 through 10.0, Thunderbird ESR 10.x
before 10.0.3, and SeaMonkey before 2.8 does not check the validity of
an instance after event dispatching, which allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or
possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors, as demonstrated
by Mobile Firefox on Android.

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:19070
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:19070
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:19499
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:19499

Unspecified vulnerability in the Java Runtime Environment (JRE)
component in Oracle Java SE 7 through Update 11 and 6 through Update
38 allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, and
availability via unknown vectors related to Deployment, a different
vulnerability than other CVEs listed in the February 2013 CPU.  NOTE:
the previous information is from the February 2013 CPU. Oracle has not
commented on claims from a third party that the issue is due to an
interaction error in between the JRE plug-in for WebKit-based browsers
and the Javascript engine, which allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code by modifying DOM nodes that contain applet elements in
a way that triggers an incorrect reference count and a use after free.

identified by the researcher, who reportedly stated "it really doesn't
matter if it's third-party code."

Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA12-164A.html
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:14717
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:14717

Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 SP2, 3.5, 3.5.1, 4, and 4.5 does not
properly handle function pointers, which allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code via (1) a crafted XAML browser application (aka
XBAP) or (2) a crafted .NET Framework application, aka ".NET Framework
Memory Access Vulnerability."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2012-1895
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-1895
Phase: Assigned (20120322)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS12-074
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS12-074
Reference: CERT:TA12-318A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA12-318A.html

Reference: SECTRACK:1027753
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1027753
Reference: SECUNIA:51236
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/51236

The reflection implementation in Microsoft .NET Framework 1.0 SP3, 1.1
SP1, 2.0 SP2, 3.5.1, and 4 does not properly enforce object
permissions, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code
via (1) a crafted XAML browser application (aka XBAP) or (2) a crafted
.NET Framework application, aka "Reflection Bypass Vulnerability."

Firefox 4.x through 12.0, Firefox ESR 10.x before 10.0.6, Thunderbird

before 2.10 does not properly handle attempted clickjacking of the
about:certerror page, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to
trick users into adding an unintended exception via an IFRAME element.

iPhone and iPod touch, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web
script or HTML via vectors involving use of this app in conjunction
with a web browser.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Category:

3.4.2 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML
via the (1) absender_name, (2) absender_email, or (3)
absender_nachricht parameter to the content page; (4) comment_name,
(5) comment_subject, or (6) comment_message parameter to the
postacomment module; (7) module parameter to index.php; (8) action
parameter to the admin login page; (9) pv or (10) pe parameter in a

(13) user_forename, (14) user_name, (15) user_street, (16)

parameter in a newUser action to the user module; (20) group_name or
(21) group_desc parameter in a groupNew action to the user module;
(22) name, (23) browsername, (24) seostring, (25) keywords, or (26)
folder_id parameter in a newPage action to the pages module; (27)
element_name or (28) element_cachetime parameter in a newElement
action in the pages module; (29) aspect_name parameter in a newAspect
action in the system module; (30) filemanager_name, (31)
filemanager_path, (32) filemanager_upload_filter, or (33)
filemanager_view_filter parameter in a NewRepo action to the
filemanager module; or (34) archive_title or (35) archive_path
parameter in a newArchive action to the downloads module.  NOTE: some
of these details are obtained from third party information.

Name: CVE-2012-4388
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-4388
Phase: Assigned (20120821)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[internals] 20120203 [PHP-DEV] The case of HTTP response splitting protection in PHP
Reference: URL:http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.php.devel/70584
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20120829 php header() header injection detection bypass
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/08/29/5
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20120901 Re: php header() header injection detection bypass
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/09/02/1
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20120905 Re: php header() header injection detection bypass
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/09/05/15
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20120906 Re: Re: php header() header injection detection bypass
Reference: URL:http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/09/07/3
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=60227
Reference: CONFIRM:http://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2012-4388
Reference: CONFIRM:http://svn.php.net/viewvc/php/php-src/branches/PHP_5_4/main/SAPI.c?r1=323986&r2=323985&pathrev=323986
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2013:1315
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2013-08/msg00006.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-1569-1
Reference: URL:http://www.ubuntu.com/usn/USN-1569-1
Reference: SECTRACK:1027463
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1027463

The sapi_header_op function in main/SAPI.c in PHP 5.4.0RC2 through
5.4.0 does not properly determine a pointer during checks for %0D
sequences (aka carriage return characters), which allows remote
attackers to bypass an HTTP response-splitting protection mechanism
via a crafted URL, related to improper interaction between the PHP
header function and certain browsers, as demonstrated by Internet
Explorer and Google Chrome.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of
an incorrect fix for CVE-2011-1398.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

mshtml.dll in Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 through 9 allows remote
attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted web site, as
exploited in the wild in September 2012.

Name: CVE-2012-6107

Phase: Assigned (20121206)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[axis-c-dev] 20130107 JIRA AXIS2C-1619 SSL/TLS hostname validation
Reference: URL:http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/axis-c-dev/201301.mbox/browser
Reference: MISC:https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AXIS2C-1619

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/57267
Reference: XF:axis2c-ssl-spoofing(81211)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/81211

Apache Axis2/C does not verify that the server hostname matches a
domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) or subjectAltName field
of the X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to
spoof SSL servers via an arbitrary valid certificate.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2013-0001
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-0001
Phase: Assigned (20121127)
Category: 
Reference: MS:MS13-004
Reference: URL:http://technet.microsoft.com/security/bulletin/MS13-004
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:15814
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:15814

The Windows Forms (aka WinForms) component in Microsoft .NET Framework
1.0 SP3, 1.1 SP1, 2.0 SP2, 3.0 SP2, 4, and 4.5 does not properly
initialize memory arrays, which allows remote attackers to obtain
sensitive information via (1) a crafted XAML browser application
(XBAP) or (2) a crafted .NET Framework application that leverages a
pointer to an unmanaged memory location, aka "System Drawing
Information Disclosure Vulnerability."

Microsoft .NET Framework 1.0 SP3, 1.1 SP1, 2.0 SP2, 3.0 SP2, 3.5,

via (1) a crafted XAML browser application (XBAP) or (2) a crafted

during a memory copy operation, aka "WinForms Buffer Overflow

Reference: UBUNTU:USN-1806-1
Reference: URL:http://www.ubuntu.com/usn/USN-1806-1
Reference: CERT:TA13-107A
Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/ncas/alerts/TA13-107A
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:16297
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:16297
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:19463
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:19463
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:19641
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:19641

The Java Runtime Environment (JRE) component in Oracle Java SE 7
Update 17 and earlier, 6 Update 43 and earlier, and 5.0 Update 41 and
earlier; and OpenJDK 6 and 7; allows remote attackers to execute
arbitrary code via vectors related to AWT, as demonstrated by Ben
Murphy during a Pwn2Own competition at CanSecWest 2013.  NOTE: the
previous information is from the April 2013 CPU. Oracle has not
commented on claims from another vendor that this issue is related to
invocation of the system class loader by the
sun.awt.datatransfer.ClassLoaderObjectInputStream class, which allows
remote attackers to bypass Java sandbox restrictions.


Current Votes:

component in Oracle Java SE 7 Update 17 and earlier and JavaFX 2.2.7
and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via
unspecified vectors related to JavaFX, as demonstrated by VUPEN during
a Pwn2Own competition at CanSecWest 2013.

to obtain sensitive information via a padding oracle attack that
targets certain UTF-8 processing of the krypto parameter, and
leverages unspecified browser access or traffic-log access.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2013-0910
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-0910
Phase: Assigned (20130107)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://googlechromereleases.blogspot.com/2013/03/stable-channel-update_4.html

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:16574
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:16574

Google Chrome before 25.0.1364.152 does not properly manage the
interaction between the browser process and renderer processes during
authorization of the loading of a plug-in, which makes it easier for
remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions via vectors
involving a blocked plug-in.

Name: CVE-2013-3132

Category: 
Reference: MS:MS13-052

Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/ncas/alerts/TA13-190A
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:17430
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:17430

Microsoft .NET Framework 1.0 SP3, 1.1 SP1, 2.0 SP2, 3.5, 3.5.1, 4, and
4.5 does not properly check the permissions of objects that use
reflection, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code
via (1) a crafted XAML browser application (XBAP) or (2) a crafted
.NET Framework application, aka "Delegate Reflection Bypass
Vulnerability."

The serialization functionality in Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 SP2,
3.5, 3.5 SP1, 3.5.1, 4, and 4.5 does not properly check the
permissions of delegate objects, which allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code via (1) a crafted XAML browser application
(XBAP) or (2) a crafted .NET Framework application that leverages a
partial-trust relationship, aka "Delegate Serialization
Vulnerability."

The SecureSphere Operations Manager (SOM) Management Server in Imperva
SecureSphere 9.0.0.5 allows context-dependent attackers to obtain
sensitive information by leveraging the presence of (1) a session ID
in the jsessionid field to secsphLogin.jsp or (2) credentials in the
j_password parameter to j_acegi_security_check, and reading (a)
web-server access logs, (b) web-server Referer logs, or (c) the
browser history.

Name: CVE-2013-4200
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-4200
Phase: Assigned (20130612)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20140116 CVE-2013-4200 - Plone URL redirection / Forwarding of cookie data (session hijack) in certain browsers
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/530787/100/0/threaded
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20130801 Re: CVE Request -- Plone: 20130618 Hotfix (multiple
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/08/01/2
Reference: CONFIRM:http://plone.org/products/plone-hotfix/releases/20130618
Reference: CONFIRM:http://plone.org/products/plone/security/advisories/20130618-announcement
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2013-4200

The isURLInPortal method in the URLTool class in in_portal.py in Plone
2.1 through 4.1, 4.2.x through 4.2.5, and 4.3.x through 4.3.1 treats
URLs starting with a space as a relative URL, which allows remote
attackers to bypass the allow_external_login_sites filtering property, 
redirect users to arbitrary web sites, and conduct phishing attacks
via a space before a URL in the "next" parameter to
acl_users/credentials_cookie_auth/require_login.

Name: CVE-2013-6166
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-6166
Phase: Assigned (20131016)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20130403 browser document.cookie DoS vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/04/03/10
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20131016 Re: browser document.cookie DoS vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2013/q4/117
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20131017 Re: browser document.cookie DoS vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2013/q4/121
Reference: MISC:http://redmine.lighttpd.net/issues/2188
Reference: CONFIRM:https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=238041

Google Chrome before 29 sends HTTP Cookie headers without first
validating that they have the required character-set restrictions,
which allows remote attackers to conduct the equivalent of a
persistent Logout CSRF attack via a crafted parameter that forces a
web application to set a malformed cookie within an HTTP response.

before 32.0.1700.76 on Windows and before 32.0.1700.77 on Mac OS X and

account by leveraging improper handling of the closing of an untrusted

Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.mozilla.org/security/announce/2014/mfsa2014-23.html

Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2014:0418
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2014-03/msg00016.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2014:0419
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2014-03/msg00017.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2014:0448
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2014-03/msg00022.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2014:0584
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2014-04/msg00016.html

The session-restore feature in Mozilla Firefox before 28.0 and
SeaMonkey before 2.25 does not consider the Content Security Policy of
a data: URL, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct
cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via a crafted document that is
accessed after a browser restart.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-2391
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-2391
Phase: Assigned (20140313)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20140408 Open-Xchange Security Advisory 2014-04-08
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/531762

The password recovery service in Open-Xchange AppSuite before
7.2.2-rev20, 7.4.1 before 7.4.1-rev11, and 7.4.2 before 7.4.2-rev13
makes an improper decision about the sensitivity of a string
representing a previously used but currently invalid password, which
allows remote attackers to obtain potentially useful password-pattern
information by reading (1) a web-server access log, (2) a web-server
Referer log, or (3) browser history that contains this string because
of its presence in a GET request.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-2392
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-2392
Phase: Assigned (20140313)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20140408 Open-Xchange Security Advisory 2014-04-08
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/531762

The E-Mail autoconfiguration feature in Open-Xchange AppSuite before
7.2.2-rev20, 7.4.1 before 7.4.1-rev11, and 7.4.2 before 7.4.2-rev13
places a password in a GET request, which allows remote attackers to
obtain sensitive information by reading (1) web-server access logs,
(2) web-server Referer logs, or (3) the browser history.

None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-3172
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-3172
Phase: Assigned (20140503)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://googlechromereleases.blogspot.com/2014/08/stable-channel-update_26.html

Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2014/dsa-3039

Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2014-09/msg00027.html
Reference: SECTRACK:1030767
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1030767

The Debugger extension API in
browser/extensions/api/debugger/debugger_api.cc in Google Chrome
before 37.0.2062.94 does not validate a tab's URL before an attach
operation, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended access
limitations via an extension that uses a restricted URL, as
demonstrated by a chrome:// URL.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-7948
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-7948
Phase: Assigned (20141006)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://googlechromereleases.blogspot.com/2015/01/stable-update.html

Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-201502-13
Reference: URL:http://security.gentoo.org/glsa/glsa-201502-13.xml
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2015:0093
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-0093.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2015:0441
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-03/msg00005.html

Reference: SECUNIA:62575
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62575

The AppCacheUpdateJob::URLFetcher::OnResponseStarted function in
content/browser/appcache/appcache_update_job.cc in Google Chrome
before 40.0.2214.91 proceeds with AppCache caching for SSL sessions
even if there is an X.509 certificate error, which allows
man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof HTML5 application content via a
crafted certificate.

Category: 
Reference: FULLDISC:20151125 Slider Revolution/Showbiz Pro shell upload exploit
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2014/Nov/78
Reference: MISC:https://blog.sucuri.net/2014/12/revslider-vulnerability-leads-to-massive-wordpress-soaksoak-compromise.html
Reference: MISC:https://plugins.trac.wordpress.org/browser/patch-for-revolution-slider/trunk/revsliderpatch.php

Reference: MISC:https://wpvulndb.com/vulnerabilities/7954
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.themepunch.com/products/old-revolution-slider-pre-4-2-vulnerabilty-explained/

The ThemePunch Slider Revolution (revslider) plugin before 3.0.96 for
WordPress and Showbiz Pro plugin 1.7.1 and earlier for Wordpress does
not properly restrict access to administrator AJAX functionality,
which allows remote attackers to (1) upload and execute arbitrary
files via an update_plugin action; (2) delete arbitrary sliders via a
delete_slider action; and (3) create, (4) update, (5) import, or (6)
export arbitrary sliders via unspecified vectors.

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/100717

The OriginCanAccessServiceWorkers function in
content/browser/service_worker/service_worker_dispatcher_host.cc in
Google Chrome before 40.0.2214.111 on Windows, OS X, and Linux and
before 40.0.2214.109 on Android does not properly restrict the URI
scheme during a ServiceWorker registration, which allows remote
attackers to gain privileges via a filesystem: URI.

ServiceWorkerScriptCacheMap implementation in

Google Chrome before 41.0.2272.76 allow remote attackers to cause a
denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via

call, related to the NotifyStartedCaching and NotifyFinishedCaching
functions.

before 42.0.2311.90 does not always display "Media: Allowed by you" in

web site, which might make it easier for user-assisted remote

Reference: UBUNTU:USN-2702-1
Reference: URL:http://www.ubuntu.com/usn/USN-2702-1
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-2702-2
Reference: URL:http://www.ubuntu.com/usn/USN-2702-2

Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in Mozilla
Firefox before 40.0 and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.2 allow remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and
application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown
vectors.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2015-5825
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-5825
Phase: Assigned (20150806)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT205212
Reference: CONFIRM:https://support.apple.com/HT205265
Reference: APPLE:APPLE-SA-2015-09-16-1
Reference: URL:http://lists.apple.com/archives/security-announce/2015/Sep/msg00001.html
Reference: APPLE:APPLE-SA-2015-09-30-2
Reference: URL:http://lists.apple.com/archives/security-announce/2015/Sep/msg00007.html

WebKit in Apple iOS before 9 does not properly restrict the
availability of Performance API times, which allows remote attackers
to obtain sensitive information about the browser history, mouse
movement, or network traffic via crafted JavaScript code.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-6583
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-6583
Phase: Assigned (20150821)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://googlechromereleases.blogspot.com/2015/09/stable-channel-update.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=467844
Reference: CONFIRM:https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=526825
Reference: CONFIRM:https://codereview.chromium.org/1164873003/

Google Chrome before 45.0.2454.85 does not display a location bar for
a hosted app's window after navigation away from the installation
site, which might make it easier for remote attackers to spoof content
via a crafted app, related to browser.cc and
hosted_app_browser_controller.cc.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-6757
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-6757
Phase: Assigned (20150831)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://googlechromereleases.blogspot.com/2015/10/stable-channel-update.html
Reference: CONFIRM:https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=529520
Reference: CONFIRM:https://codereview.chromium.org/1327723005

Use-after-free vulnerability in
content/browser/service_worker/embedded_worker_instance.cc in the
ServiceWorker implementation in Google Chrome before 46.0.2490.71
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have
unspecified other impact by leveraging object destruction in a
callback.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Phase: Assigned (20150914)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20150902 CVE Request : CSRF in IPython/Jupyter notebook Tree.
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2015/q3/474
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20150914 Re: CVE Request : CSRF in IPython/Jupyter notebook Tree.
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2015/q3/544
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1259405

Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2015-14902

Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2015-16128
Reference: URL:http://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/package-announce/2015-September/167670.html

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the file browser in
notebook/notebookapp.py in IPython Notebook before 3.2.2 and Jupyter
Notebook 4.0.x before 4.0.5 allows remote attackers to inject
arbitrary web script or HTML via a folder name.  NOTE: this was
originally reported as a cross-site request forgery (CSRF)
vulnerability, but this may be inaccurate.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-7368
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-7368
Phase: Assigned (20150925)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20151007 [REVIVE-SA-2015-001] Revive Adserver - Multiple vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/536633/100/0/threaded
Reference: FULLDISC:20151008 [REVIVE-SA-2015-001] Revive Adserver - Multiple vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2015/Oct/32
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/133893/Revive-Adserver-3.2.1-CSRF-XSS-Local-File-Inclusion.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.revive-adserver.com/security/revive-sa-2015-001
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/revive-adserver/revive-adserver/commit/15aac363

Revive Adserver before 3.2.2 does not send the appropriate
Cache-Control HTTP headers in responses for admin UI pages, which
allows local users to obtain sensitive information via the web browser
cache.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)
